29001.name: MENSA Challenge your IQ Pack
29001.description:
From the box:

A compendium of puzzles and games to stretch your brain to the limits.

This pack contain a set of ingenious games, puzzles and activities designed by MENSA, the international high IQ society, to hone your mental powers until they're razor sharp. There is a book containing series of IQ-type puzzles that will test both your speed of thought and mental agility. In addition there is a board game that will provide the whole family with hours of puzzle-solving fun, and another that helps to build vocabulary.. There are 3D-puzzles that will put you through many hours of mental struggle as you try to reach seemingly impossible solutions. But you don't have to be a genius to enjoy this pack.

There is two boardgames in this pack. The first, Wild Words, is a word game for any number of player. The players must move their counters accordingly to a die roll and respecting certain restrictions. On a 10 x 16 board with a letter in each square. Every player will have to collect an equal number of letters and have a limited time at the end of a round to form a word with his collected letters.
The second game is called Puzzle mountain. Its a kind of Snakes and ladders for six players, themed on mountain climbing. You have to be the first to reach the summit after leaving the base camp. There are crevasses and ropes, you have to solve a puzzle-card to climb along the ropes or not falling down along crevasses.

The pack contain:
book of MENSA puzzles, 100 puzzle-cards, a 2-sided game board, dice and counters, puzzle cubes, tessellated tiles and instructions for the games plus all solutions.

29002.name: Bolletjes (Veilig Verkeerspel)
29002.description: Simple promotional pocket game for Bolletje biscuits. The game had to be cut from the biscuit box.

29003.name: Wetten, dass..?
29003.description:
"Wetten, dass..?" is a very popular television show in German-speaking countries. The main concept of the show are bets: Common people perform some unusual/difficult tasks and the celebrity guests must bet on the outcome of the performance and offer a wager.

The game includes a board and 3 different decks of task-cards: Knowledge, Activity, Wildcard. While one player has to fulfill the task, the other players must bet on the outcome. They wager chips and may move forward (to the center) if they are right.
If you reach the center and fulfill the Activity-card, you will win!
The Wildcards are blank cards, all players are allowed to think of new tasks before the game.

29004.name: Six Million Dollar Man

boardgamefamily.21936: TV Series: The Six Million Dollar Man

29004.description:
This unpublished prototype board game was originally in Sid Sackson's game collection before it came into my possession.

The game shows some similarities to Parker Brothers' Six Million Dollar Man game and may be a very early version of the game. The mechanics are more complex than the average children's roll-and-move game.

Each player is dealt a hand of four cards at the start of the game and draw one card at the start of each turn. There are several different types of cards in the deck:

- Bionics Cards (Cards for Steve Austin's Bionic Eye, Bionic Arm, and Bionic Leg abilities)
- "Wild" Bionics Cards (May be used as any type of Bionics)
- Move Opponent
- Set Obstacle
- Remove Obstacle

Some of the spaces on the board are marked with one or more bionics symbols that represent cards the player must use to get past that particular challenge. For example, you may need to use a Bionic Eye card to spot an enemy airplane or use one Bionic Arm and two Bionic Leg cards in order to swim across a treacherous river. A player landing on one of these spaces must discard the needed cards before being able to move again.

The obstacles are balanced by the paths that the player can take across the board. The shortest path from start to finish is densely populated with some heavy challenge spaces (requiring up to four cards to get past). By contrast, the longer routes have a smaller density of challenge spaces, usually with one to two card challenges.

Interestingly, the players move by the difference of a roll of two dice. Roll two dice and subtract the lower number from the higher to determine how far you move. This means that rolling doubles means you get zero; you don't move.

The rules I have are incomplete. They do not explain how to use the Move Opponent, Set Obstacle, or Remove Obstacle cards.

29005.description:
Battue: The Walls of Tarsos is the first expansion Battue: Storm of the Horse Lords. As the battle deepens, players will find new challenges to overcome and more rewards for success. Although the goal, to loot the richest sections of town to prove your right to lead the Golden Horde, is the same, the means to that end are much different. Rivals arise and defenders band together within the city to prevent the pillage.

Battue: The Walls of Tarsos is an expansion to Battue: Storm of the Horse Lords, a strategy board game for 2-4 players. Players fight to claim city sections and defend them against other players while collecting the most valuable loot to win the game.

Contents:

• Rulebook
• 8 Wall tiles
• 4 Gate tiles
• 4 Tower tiles
• 13 Interior tiles
• 8 New Event cards
• 13 New Loot cards
• 6 New Warriors

Expands:

Battue: Storm of the Horse Lords




Expanded by:

Templum Vulcan [promotional tile released in 2008]
29005.name: Battue: The Walls of Tarsos

27823.name: Battue: Storm of the Horse Lords

29006.name: Strongholds: Axe & Shield
29006.description:
Strongholds: Axe & Shield is the third releases set in the world of Terris. In this game, along with its sister product Stronghold: Ancient Rivals players get to try their hand at empire building, starting with their own castle. Each player tries to become the first one to complete their castle while preventing other players from doing the same. Winning players must not only manage their castle construction, but successfully attack and defend with their troops as well.

Strongholds: Axe & Shield and Strongholds: Ancient Rivals are each sold separately. Each package contains all the materials needed for a 2 player game. They can be combined or played separately. You can purchase multiple copies of either game to support more players. Future starters and expansions will be sold in a non-collectable format, allowing players to create the types of games that suit them.

In Strongholds: Axe & Shield the rapidly expanding empire of the Dotur seek to secure their northern boarders against the Dwarven raiders of Thulea.

Contents

• 60 game tiles
• 2 player sheets
• 1 die
• 1 Full-Color rulebook

29007.name: Strongholds: Ancient Rivals
29007.description:
Strongholds: Ancient Rivals is the third released set in the world of Terris. In this game, and it's sister product Strongholds: Axe & Shield, players get to try their hand at empire building, starting with their own castle. Each player tries to become the first one to complete their castle while preventing other players from doing the same. Winning players must not only manage their castle construction, but successfully attack and defend with their troops as well.

Strongholds: Axe & Shield and Strongholds: Ancient Rivals are each sold separately. Each package contains all the materials needed for a 2 player game. They can be combined or played separately. You can purchase multiple copies of either game to support more players. Future starters and expansions will be sold in a non-collectible format, allowing players to create the types of games that suit them.

Strongholds: Ancient Rivals pits the mighty Roma Empire against their ancient Fey rivals from Frikara, the Tyrians and their Thulean mercenaries.

Contents

• 60 game tiles
• 2 player sheets
• 1 die
• 1 Full-Color rulebook

29008.name: Mansuba: Challenge of the Pharaohs
29008.description:
All the world is move and counter-move. A Pharaoh who wishes to rule his people wisely learns this early in his schooling. To see and anticipate the interactions of the figures on the Mansuba board is the beginning of understanding. To master those figures is the beginning of wisdom.

Mansuba: Challenge of the Pharaohs is a game of movement and trumping. Each player tries to be the first to get all six of their totem figures safely across the board. Totem figures move by roll of the dice-sticks using simple movement and jumping. You control all the same pieces as the other players, but how and when you move them is the key to victory.

Visit us at www.RedJuggernaut.com for fiction, news, information, answers to questions, and more!
Contents
1 playing board
36 Mansuba totem figures
6 each of Falcon, Woman, Crocodile, Ibis, Jackal, and Cat
6 Dice Sticks
1 Rules booklet

Players
2-6

Ages
10+

Time
30-90 minutes

Product Number RDJ20000

29009.name: Starfighter: Academy
29009.description:
The alien Thrall have invaded the Sol system. Star*Corps has sent out a call for new pilots to fly the latest fighting ships against the most dire threat mankind has ever faced.

Starfighter:Academy is fast-paced game of strategy and luck for two or more players. As Cadets, players choose and customize their own "sim" ships for battle in the Academy's sim-pods as they train for an assignment straight from their worst nightmares.

A special deck of Starfighter cards and an assortment of dice enable you to create Academy simulator action on your own tabletop. The game is quick to learn, fast to play, and gives you a chance to try out a variety of Starfighter designs in your effort to find the perfect ship to take out against the enemy.

Home Page: http://starfightercg.tripod.com

29010.name: Walk the Plank
29010.description:
Walk the Plank is a fast-moving card game for three to nine players, ages eight and up. The object is to win the most battles in any given round to become Captain for the next round. But be careful – if you don’t win ANY battles in a round, you’re out of the game. You’re dealt fewer cards in each successive round, and the player who wins the final round wins the game! Play is fast and furious, with an average game time of only 10 minutes.

Walk the Plank comes with a deck of 68 cards. The deck has sixty-five numbered cards, two Walk the Plank! cards, and one Sea Monster! card. The sixty-five numbered cards are divided into five suits: Doubloons, Hookhands, Monkeys, Parrots, and Peglegs. The cards in each suit are numbered 1 through 13, with 1 worth the least and 13 worth the most.

The first dealer, or Captain, deals 7 cards to each player in the first round of seven. Subsequent rounds deal one less card. (Round 2 is 6 cards, Round 3 is 5 cards, etc.) The Captain then turns over the top card on the deck so that everyone may see it. The suit of the card revealed will be trump for the first round. The trump suit is the most powerful suit in any given battle. For example, if Monkeys are trump, then a low card in Monkeys will beat even a higher-numbered card in any other suit. If the card the Captain turns over is a Walk the Plank! or a Sea Monster!, there is no trump suit for this first round. In every round after the first, whoever is Captain chooses the trump suit after looking at his or her cards.

The suit of the first card played in a battle is called the current suit. If this card is a numbered card, it may or may not be from the trump suit. If the first card played in a battle is one of the three special cards, there is no current suit for that battle, but each player still has to play one card.

You must play a card of the same suit as the first card played in each battle, if you can. We call this following suit. So if you have any cards in your hand of the same suit as the first one played in a battle, you have to pick one and play it. You don’t have to follow suit if you have no cards in the current suit. You don’t have to follow suit if you have a special card (Walk the Plank! or Sea Monster!), unless you choose not to play the special card.

Walk the Plank! will win any battle, beating even the highest card in the trump suit—think of it as a “wild card” worth one more than the highest card in play. When someone plays Sea Monster!, no one wins the battle, no matter what cards
have been played. The player who played Sea Monster! doesn't win the battle, but he/she does gain control. (So he/she gets to choose the current suit for the next battle by playing the first card.)

The player who wins the battle in the round becomes the Captain in the next round, which means you get to play the first card in the next battle.

If you win one or more battles in a round in which no other player wins a battle, you win the game!

29011.name: Mensch ärgere Dich nicht: Das Kartenspiel
29011.description: The object of the game is to be the first to have a set (1-6) of the same color. It doesn't matter if a Special Joker or a Colored Joker are part of the set.

29012.description:
From the publisher's website:

Metropolis: Battle-force Conflicts
The war in Iskandria is escalating and the initial skirmishing is developing into full-blown military conflict. In response, all the warring factions are throwing in ever-increasing numbers of fresh troops, including heavier armoured elements and specialists.

With your Urban War strike-team as the core, Metropolis enables you to build much larger battle-forces to pit against your enemies in full-scale warfare.

Game Intro
Metropolis moves the action up a level from the small-scale skirmishes played out in Urban War. It shifts the focus from the individual to the squad. Your armies, or ‘Battle-forces’, will largely consist of several squads that vary in size, but normally contain around five to ten troopers. Accompanying them will be various individual models that represent important officers and characters, and larger more powerful war machines and vehicles.

Each faction has a different battle-force structure. Various basic squads form the foundation of their battle-forces, with the mix of support, assault, and elite squads, and the accompanying individuals and war machines, giving each their own unique flavour.
29012.name: Metropolis

29013.name: Rahala
29013.description:
Rahala (Explorers)is a quiz board-game for the age of 15 and above. It covers the history of the Arab World from the 20th Century B.C. until the end of the 20th Century A.D.. The game divides this history into six eras, and the spirit of each historic era is captured thematically through its questions and graphical representation. Players use cards to ask each other History and Open Questions, and then use playing pieces to journey along paths of squares in a labyrinth. Era tokens mark the completion of travel over a certain era. The objective is to amass Points of Knowledge.

Through its History Questions, Rahala aims to highlight the multifaceted makeup of the Arab civilization. The questions comprise a mix of topics presented in a playful manner while revealing the widely spread geographic boundaries of the Arab World along with its people, religions, minorities, scientific discoveries,cultural milieus, and interaction with other civilizations.

In addition to the history element, the game includes Open Questions that allow for discussions among the players over highly challenging topics.

29014.description:
For a brief period, Ferdinand Graf Zeppelin's giant gas-filled airships ruled the world's skies. Though conceived as passenger craft, during the First World War rigid and semi-rigid airships performed long-range scouting and bombing missions.

Great War at Sea: Zeppelins includes die-cut-and-mounted playing pieces, but these are special, oversized ones: 2/3-inch by 1-and-1/3-inch large pieces depicting famous airships of Germany, Great Britain, the United States, Italy, Austria-Hungary and France. These are used with the new tactical and operational rules provided; unlike the standard game rules that treat all airships the same, with the Zeppelins module, each airship class has its own range and endurance qualities.

Every airship that played an important role in the First World War is present, both German Navy and German Army machines that scouted for the High Seas Fleet and attacked naval targets. The ultra-long-range "Africa Ship" L59 is present, along with the big, modern L100 class canceled by the war's end.

The Royal Navy maintained a large fleet of airships, and the British get the Italian-built semi-rigid airship SR-1 along with the many rigid airships built at war's end. Italy built a large number of semi-rigid airships (with a solid keel rather than a complete frame as with a true zeppelin) and these are also included.

The United States Navy gets its Shenandoah and Los Angeles, and the United States Army the big semi-rigid airship Roma. The French Dixmude, a former German zeppelin, is here as are Austria-Hungary's small contingent.

New airship-centered scenarios, or modifications of current scenarios, are included for many of the Great War at Sea series games: Mediterranean, Jutland, U.S. Navy Plan Gold, U.S. Navy Plan Red and Dreadnoughts.
29014.name: Great War at Sea: Zeppelins

29015.name: Gotham Pro League Basketball
29015.description: This game featured sturdy steel construction and had 10 players who could run, block and rebound. The players were controlled by a series of levers similar to table top hockey games.

29016.name: King Kong Game
29016.description:
Here comes King Kong to smash up your town! Made by Ideal Games in 1963 this King Kong Game is almost exactly like the Godzilla Game made by Ideal in the same year.

the objective is to avoid Kong while making your way to the Empire State Building.

Hard to find and sought after by collectors.

29017.description:
From the publisher's description:

Wild animal sounds screech out from the jungle, but in order to find the mythical Mayan treasures, the treasure hunters have to cross the jungle. Suddenly an old and long forgotten Mayan temple appears in front of them. Two stone guards stand at its entrance staring the treasure hunters down with a fierce glare.

Who will be brave, quick and skillful enough to retrieve the treasures of the jungle?
29017.name: Jungle Treasure

29018.description:
From the publisher's description:

Who can snap up the best cards more quickly than the other players? One player turns over the cards (good and bad!) and each player has three chances to take up the cards which have been laid out. Clever timing and quick action are important to get the most points.

Take it! - Keep cool, but not for too long!

This is a reworked version of Her Damit/It's Mine!, with a slightly different card assortment and no "jackpot" cards.
29018.name: Take It!

29019.name: Gildia
29019.description:
Gildia is trade-bidding card game. Player are Masters of a Guild and they are trying to invest their funds as good as possible. Everything is on sale from blacksmith to alchemist.

Box contains:
40 funds cards
50 property cards
5 tax-collector cards
4 administrator cards
rule book

29020.description:
From the same family of Party & Co, Party & Co Extreme is made out of 4 different categories of games: 'Quiz & Co, 'Psyco & Co', 'Show & Co' and 'Art & Co'. Each category have different card games including some like Pictionary, Taboo, Trivial-Pursuit...

People have to compete with each other in teams until they fill out his objective card (a number of games won).

The game includes:
800 cards with different games (200 of each category).
48 'peanuts' (12 of each color)
A pair of party glasses (blind-drawing game) with a color pencil
2 pencils and 2 block notes
1 'flexispaghetti' (shape game)
10 objective cards
1 die and a instructions booklet
29020.name: Party & Co: Extreme

29021.name: Wheeling
29021.description: One of the old all-time classic English games. The game represents a race from London to the Anchor's pub at Ripley.

29022.name: Storm over the Taiwan Strait

8115.name: Oriental Flagship (BEIJING) International Technology CO., LTD

29022.description:
This game is the first in the Oriental Flagship Company's "This is No Drill" series. The theme is a future Mainland Chinese invasion of Taiwan.

The game includes 125 counters, a foamboard-mounted map with a hexagonal grid superimposed on a satellite photo of Taiwan, a novel sliding Combat Resolution Table (instead of dice), a counter tray, and a very nice box.

The game, sometimes described as the first Mainland Chinese board wargame, is closely based on Ty Bomba's When Dragons Fight.

29023.name: Invasão da Polônia
29023.description:
Original introductory wargame, released in early 80´s in Brazil, from a small company called JOG. The games was quite simple, last just with 5 turns< The game had a small map and eleven counters. The main idea of JOG was to introduce the hobby in Brazil, but by 1982, the company was broke and the JOG remains only in the memories of veteran wargamers. Polonia (or Invasion of Poland) was the first of a game series which included another wargames (France 1940, Barbarossa, Ardennes, etc), but there were errors in order of battle, etc.

But JOG and their other games created the first generation of wargamers in Brazil, and now many of them, recognize the great importance of this initiative.

29024.name: Mission Antarctique
29024.description:
You and your crew explore Antarctica searching for the Jonas expedition, mysteriously lost 20 years ago.
You'll have to answer questions in 7 different places (about polar regions) or win contests to receive evidence to be the first to find Jonas expedition.

29025.name: I Dream Of Jeannie
29025.description: Simple roll and move game based on the TV series of the same name which was on from 1962 to 1967. The show starred Barbara Eden as Jeannie, Larry Hagman, later of Dallas fame, as Astronaut Tony Nelson ("Master") and Bill Dailey as Roger Healy, Nelson's astronaut friend.

29026.description:
Rules for use with OGRE and G.E.V. miniatures adapting the hex-and-counter mechanics for table-top (hexless) use with OGRE Miniatures.

A gratis slimmed down version (Ogre Miniatures Lite) is available from the publisher's web site. Also, a free supplement (Ogre Miniatures Update) is available on e23 (SJGames's download shop).
29026.name: Ogre Miniatures

29027.description:
"A revved-up game book!"

This "book" is actually a set of four game boards, four counters, and a unique stop-light, which replaces dice or spinners by randomly choosing red, yellow or green lights. Each of the boards is essentially a roll-and-move race to the finish board, but some offer variants in how to move.
29027.name: Start Your Engines!

29028.description:
In this memory game, known both as Cheese Please and La Fromagerie, the players' mice attempt to drag large pieces of cheese to their hole. In order to move a mouse, you must correctly recall which mouse is sitting on which piece of cheese. Of course, there is a cat lurking about....

Ages 4 and up.

Piatnik 641497 (not to be confused with Cheeeese Please, by Rudi Hoffmann)
29028.name: Cheese Please

29029.name: Clashes for the Ashes
29029.description:
An exciting cricket game that can be played anywhere using picture cards of actual players from both Test teams. Players can pick their order of batting & bowling.
Dice are used to score runs & take wickets. The game is designed so that the top batsmen have more chance of higher scores & the top bowlers can take more wickets.

29030.description: Players are notorious gang bosses in the heyday of organized crime in Chicago during the 1920s. The goal of the game is to take control of the main legal and illegal sources of profit, meaning bars, game rooms, jazz clubs and revue theaters. To do this, each player sends his men to intimidate the owners of these businesses and gain them to their cause. Most of the businesses even change ownership at the game table! The winner is the first player who, by playing poker combinations with his cards, takes control over 3 businesses of the same kind, 4 different ones, or any 5.
29030.name: Chicago Poker

29031.description: Subbuteo Squads is a card game for two players. Each player plays with a deck of 45 cards. A full game lasts for 90 cards, a full deck per half. Players can have any combination of players cards and/or incident cards. Decks can be built with supplemental "booster" packs which have unique incidents, great players, and famous football pitches.
29031.name: Subbuteo Squads

29032.name: Hanni & Nanni
29032.description:
A merchandising game from the "Hanni & Nanni" (English: St. Clare's) series from Enyd Blyton.
Players using dice to race around St.Clares trying to collect a collection of clothes cards.

29033.name: Take My Word
29033.description: The game consists of 108 letter cards valued 1-4 and a simple board (a score pad is also included). Players start with a hand of 7 cards, then take turns adding one card to the front or back of the word being formed on the board, drawing a new card from the deck at the end of each turn. A player who cannot add a card that makes a legal word fragment must "Take My Word" and put all the played cards into a penalty stack. The game ends when the deck runs out; lowest score wins.

29034.name: Murder of a Millionaire
29034.description:
From the publisher's website:

Your 'traditional' murder-mystery, but run in not-so-traditional way.

Invite your guests to the will reading of the late Rick Rochester, a man worth millions. Watch as they compete to see who can win the inheritance by searching out his killer, an individual that is destined to strike again at the party. Did the butler do it? Or is it the blackmailing sister who seems to be spending a fortune she hasn’t yet inherited? There is always the jealous ex-wife who was left 20 years ago and may still have vengeance in her heart. Or could it be the gold-digging son-in-law that wants not only the millionaire's daughter, but his fortune as well. It is up to you and your guests to see if the murderer will be found guilty or go free...

The package includes:


A Host Guide — A complete how-to of throwing your party which includes directions on preparing the invitations, assigning characters and preparing for the party.
A Schedule of the Night — A step-by-step breakdown of how the night will go.
An Introduction — to be read to the guests upon arrival.
Designed Invitations — that you can customize with the details of your party.
A Copy of a Memorium to Rick Rochester — including background information on the deceased and the guest list.
18 Character Sheets— full descriptions of the characters, including costuming and acting tips.
18 Character Objective Sheets— this includes objectives for each character to try to achieve at each stage of the game in order to uncover evidence and find the murderer.
18 Name Tags
Fake Money— to be distributed to guests and used in the party for scheming and bribery.
Evidence — more clues that will be presented towards the end of the night. This evidence will help your guests solve the mystery and find the murderer.
“Who Dunnit” Cards — to allow your guests to guess the murderer, along with vote for the most animated character and best outfit.
Award Certificates — to be awarded to the best costume, the most theatrical, the player with the most money at the end of the night and to each of the guests that solve the murder.


FORMATTED FOR 10-18 GUESTS

Home Page: http://www.nightofmystery.com/Murder_of_a_Millionaire.php

29035.name: Murder at the Juice Joint
29035.description:
From the publisher's website:

A Night of Mystery & Intrigue in the Wild & Romantic Era of the Roaring 20's!

As one of Chicago's elite, you won't want to miss the party at The Juice Joint- a swanky speakeasy run by Rosie Marie. With the murder on the menu and mayhem in the cards, you are certain to find a medley of individuals to make the night most memorable. From the mobsters and their molls, to the conniving cigarette girl and the blacklisted bootlegger. The hot Hollywood director to the sensational singer, everyone has a motive for murder, but only one will act on it. It is your job to make sure they don't go free.

The complete package includes:


A Host Guide— A complete how-to of throwing your party which includes directions on preparing the invitations, assigning characters and preparing for the party.
A Schedule of the Night— A step-by-step breakdown of how the night will go.
An Introduction— to be read to the guests upon arrival.
Designed Invitations— that you can customize with the details of your party.
The Gangster gazette — to be sent with the invitations, it includes background information on the happenings in and around The Juice Joint and the guests coming to the party.
Character Sheets— full descriptions of the characters, including costuming and acting tips.
Character Objective Sheets —this includes objectives for each character to try to achieve at each stage of the game in order to uncover evidence and find the murderer.
Name Tags
Fake Money— to be distributed to guests and used in the party for scheming and bribery.
Evidence — more clues that will be presented towards the end of the night. This evidence will help your guests solve the mystery and find the murderer.
Solution— a detailed description of who the murderer is, why the murder happened and the clues that led to the outcome.
“Who Dunnit” Cards— to allow your guests to guess the murderer, along with vote for the most animated character and best outfit.
Award Certificates— to be awarded to the best costume, the most theatrical guest, the player with the most money at the end of the night and to each of the guests that solve the murder.


THREE SEPARATE VERSIONS FORMATTED FROM 10 TO 80 GUESTS!
10-15 GUESTS --- 15-20 GUESTS --- 20-80 GUESTS

Home Page: http://www.nightofmystery.com/Murder_at_the_Juice_Joint.php

29036.name: Murder at the Deadwood Saloon
29036.description:
From the publisher's website:

Giddy up all you Cowboys & Cowgirls & get on down to the Deadwood Saloon.

Have your guests celebrate the end of the Deadwood Poker Tournament with a party that will leave them breathless (well, at least one of them). With everyone from bandits to bankers, and southern belles to saloon girls celebrating together, the result is sure to be deadly. Can your guests figure out the killer before the culprit gets away? There is but one night and one chance to put some justice back in the budding frontier town.


A Host Guide— A complete how-to of throwing your party which includes directions on preparing the invitations, assigning characters and preparing for the party.
A Schedule of the Night— A step-by-step breakdown of how the night will go.
An Introduction— to be read to the guests upon arrival.
Designed Invitations— that you can customize with the details of your party.
A Copy of the Deadwood Gazette— including background information on Deadwood and the guest list.
Character Sheets— full descriptions of the characters, including costuming and acting tips.
Character Objective Sheets —this includes objectives for each character to try to achieve at each stage of the game in order to uncover evidence and find the murderer.
Name Tags
Fake Money— to be distributed to guests and used in the party for scheming and bribery.
Evidence — more clues that will be presented towards the end of the night. This evidence will help your guests solve the mystery and find the murderer.
“Who Dunnit” Cards— to allow your guests to guess the murderer, along with vote for the most animated character and best outfit.
A Solution— a detailed description of who the murderer is, why the murder happened and the clues that led to the outcome.
Award Certificates— to be awarded to the best costume, the most theatrical, the player with the most money at the end of the night and to each of the guests that solve the murder.
Recipes and Decoration ideas—See pictures and a listing of all that is offered in this section on our party extras page.


THREE SEPARATE VERSIONS FORMATTED FOR UP TO 80 GUESTS!
7-13 GUESTS --- 14-20 GUESTS --- 20-80 GUESTS

Home Page: http://www.nightofmystery.com/Murder_at_The_Deadwood_Saloon....

29037.name: James D. Murder High School Reunion
29037.description:
From the publisher's website:

It's a Totally Eighties Class Reunion as you reunite with The Class of '85!

It's been 20 years since you and your guests left the hallowed halls of James D. Murder High. That's 20 years for grudges to be held and jealousy and hatred to fester. This will be the reunion to remember as you bring together all of your classmates to see what everyone's become. From the prom queen turned beauty queen to the math team captain who's now worth millions. The drama queen gone Hollywood to the valedictorian who STILL won't let anyone top her. There's not a soul that will miss this reunion... Just one soul who won't live to tell about it!

The package includes:


A Host Guide— A complete how-to of throwing your party which includes directions on preparing the invitations, assigning characters and preparing for the party.
A Schedule of the Night— A step-by-step breakdown of how the night will go.
An Introduction— to be read to the guests upon arrival.
Designed Invitations— that you can customize with the details of your party.
“Reunion News” Newsletter— to be sent with the invitations, it includes background information on the reunion and the guests coming to the reunion.
Character Sheets— full descriptions of the characters, including costuming and acting tips.
Character Objective Sheets —this includes objectives for each character to try to achieve at each stage of the game in order to uncover evidence and find the murderer.
Name Tags
Fake Money— to be distributed to guests and used in the party for scheming and bribery.
Evidence — more clues that will be presented towards the end of the night. This evidence will help your guests solve the mystery and find the murderer.
“Who Dunnit” Cards— to allow your guests to guess the murderer, along with vote for the most animated character and best outfit.
Solution— a detailed description of who the murderer is, why the murder happened and the clues that led to the outcome.
Award Certificates— to be awarded to the best costume, the most theatrical guest, the player with the most money at the end of the night and to each of the guests that solve the murder.


THREE SEPARATE VERSIONS FORMATTED FOR UP TO 80 GUESTS!
10-15 GUESTS -- 15-20 GUESTS -- 20-80 GUESTS

Home Page: http://www.nightofmystery.com/Murder_High_Reunion.php

29038.name: A Knight of Murder
29038.description:
From the publisher's website:

Hear ye! Hear ye! All ye Kings & Queens, Knights & Nobles!

It is an evening of Medieval Madness planned to honor the noble marriage of Baron Bartholomew to the Lady Diana of Dunnsberry. From the notorious knights to the seedy sheriff, the conniving chambermaid to the meddling maids, all the subjects of the manor are not only invited, but ordered to be here by command of the lord. With all of the secrets in the manor, it is hard to tell who will live through the night-- for any betrayal to the lord or the king IS punishable by death.

The package includes:


A Host Guide— A complete how-to of throwing your party which includes directions on preparing the invitations, assigning characters and preparing for the party.
A Schedule of the Night— A step-by-step breakdown of how the night will go.
An Introduction— to be read to the guests upon arrival.
Designed Invitations— that you can customize with the details of your party.
Manor Announcements— to be sent with the invitations, it includes background information on the happenings in the manor and the guests coming to the reunion.
Laws of the Land Poster— a poster to be hung up at the party explaining more about medieval times and how King Kyle rules his lands.
21 Character Sheets— full descriptions of the characters, including costuming and acting tips.
21 Character Objective Sheets —this includes objectives for each character to try to achieve at each stage of the game in order to uncover evidence and find the murderer.
21 Name Tags
Fake Money— to be distributed to guests and used in the party for scheming and bribery.
Evidence — more clues that will be presented towards the end of the night. This evidence will help your guests solve the mystery and find the murderer.
Solution— a detailed description of who the murderer is, why the murder happened and the clues that led to the outcome.
“Who Dunnit” Cards— to allow your guests to guess the murderer, along with vote for the most animated character and best outfit.
Award Certificates— to be awarded to the best costume, the most theatrical guest, the player with the most money at the end of the night and to each of the guests that solve the murder.


THREE SEPARATE VERSIONS FORMATTED FOR UP TO 80 GUESTS!
10-15 GUESTS -- 15-21 GUESTS -- 20-80 GUESTS

Home Page: http://www.nightofmystery.com/A_Knight_of_Murder.php

29039.name: Till Death Do Us Part
29039.description:
From the publisher's website:

A Night of Love, Marriage and MURDER!

You are a guest at the Giovanni-Simpson Wedding Reception where you will celebrate the marriage of the daughter of a mob boss to the unlikely son of a insurance salesman. It is an evening of family, friends, food and fun that quickly gets turned into a night of murder & mayhem. As family secrets get aired, motives revealed, a murder will occur and a killer sought out. Will it be the jealous ex-boyfriend? The overlooked little sister? The gold-digging in-laws? Or possibly the estranged uncle who drank away his family fortune? This gives a new meaning to the term wedding crasher.

The package includes:


A Host Guide— A complete how-to of throwing your party which includes directions on preparing the invitations, assigning characters and preparing for the party.
A Schedule of the Night— A step-by-step breakdown of how the night will go.
An Introduction— to be read to the guests upon arrival.
Designed Invitations— that you can customize with the details of your party.
A Wedding Program— including background information on all the guests attending the reception.
20 Character Sheets— full descriptions of the characters, including costuming and acting tips.
20 Character Objective Sheets —this includes objectives for each character to try to achieve at each stage of the game in order to uncover evidence and find the murderer.
20 Name Tags
Fake Money— to be distributed to guests and used in the party for scheming and bribery.
Evidence — more clues that will be presented towards the end of the night. This evidence will help your guests solve the mystery and find the murderer.
“Who Dunnit” Cards— to allow your guests to guess the murderer, along with vote for the most animated character and best outfit.
A Solution— a detailed description of who the murderer is, why the murder happened and the clues that led to the outcome.
Award Certificates— to be awarded to the best costume, the most theatrical, the player with the most money at the end of the night and to each of the guests that solve the murder.


THREE SEPARATE VERSIONS FORMATTED FOR UP TO 80 GUESTS!
10-15 GUESTS -- 15-20 GUESTS -- 20-80 GUESTS

Home Page: http://www.nightofmystery.com/Till_Death_Do_Us_Part.php

29040.name: Murder in Sin City
29040.description:
From the publisher's website:

A sinister night of sleuthing, scandals and secrets!

The Paramount Casino, the largest and most extravagant casino on the Las Vegas strip, is throwing a party of epic proportions and you are invited. With the highest rollers and the gutsiest gamblers, the stakes are going to be high and there is no limit to what could happen. With the powerful politician, the sexy showgirl, the cunning cocktail waitress and Elvis himself at the casino – the guest list is as unlimited as the possibilities of how the night will end. Like everything else in Vegas, the party will be a gamble and there is no certainty to the events of the evening.Whose secrets will be exposed? Which lies will be uncovered? And who will fall victim to the lawlessness of the night? Your bet is as good as mine.

The package includes:


A Schedule of the Night— A step-by-step breakdown of how the night will go.
An Introduction— to be read to the guests upon arrival.
Designed Invitations— that you can customize with the details of your party.
The Vegas Gambler— to be sent with the invitations, it includes background information on the happenings in and around the casino and the guests coming to the casino party.
Character Sheets— full descriptions of the characters, including costuming and acting tips.
Character Objective Sheets —this includes objectives for each character to try to achieve at each stage of the game in order to uncover evidence and find the murderer.
Name Tags
Fake Money— to be distributed to guests and used in the party for scheming and bribery.
Evidence — more clues that will be presented towards the end of the night. This evidence will help your guests solve the mystery and find the murderer.
Solution— a detailed description of who the murderer is, why the murder happened and the clues that led to the outcome.
“Who Dunnit” Cards— to allow your guests to guess the murderer, along with vote for the most animated character and best outfit.
Award Certificates— to be awarded to the best costume, the most theatrical guest, the player with the most money at the end of the night and to each of the guests that solve the murder.

29041.name: Killing for the Crown
29041.description:
From the publisher's website:

Backstabbing, Bribery and Blackmail Among Beauties.

After a week of competition at the Miss America Pageant (or Miss Teen America Pageant), these women are ready to compete! With the Miss America crown on the line, everyone seems desperate to gain the competitive edge on their rivals... and for one guest that means murder! At a pageant that is known to be plagued with scandal, why should this year be any different?

The package includes:


A Host Guide— A complete how-to of throwing your party which includes directions on preparing the invitations, assigning characters and preparing for the party.
A Schedule of the Night— A step-by-step breakdown of how the night will go.
An Introduction— to be read to the guests upon arrival.
Designed Invitations— that you can customize with the details of your party.
The Pageant Press— to be sent with the invitations, it includes background information on the happenings in and around the pageant and the guests coming to the pre-pageant party.
Character Sheets— full descriptions of the characters, including costuming and acting tips.
Character Objective Sheets —this includes objectives for each character to try to achieve at each stage of the game in order to uncover evidence and find the murderer.

Evidence — more clues that will be presented towards the end of the night. This evidence will help your guests solve the mystery and find the murderer.
Solution— a detailed description of who the murderer is, why the murder happened and the clues that led to the outcome.
“Who Dunnit” Cards— to allow your guests to guess the murderer, along with vote for the most animated character and best outfit.
Award Certificates— to be awarded to the best costume, the most theatrical guest, the player with the most money at the end of the night and to each of the guests that solve the murder.


THIS IS A (MOSTLY) FEMALE MURDER.
FORMATTED FOR 15-20 FEMALE & 0-5 MALE GUESTS OR 10-15 FEMALE & 0-5 MALE GUESTS
TWO SEPARATE VERSIONS FOR ADULTS OR TEENS!

29042.name: Murder in Margaritaland
29042.description:
From the publisher's website:

A Night of Crime and Chaos in the Caribbean.

Every night if a party in Margaritaland, the most exclusive tropical resort on the island! While most choose this vacation destination to escape their troubles, for one individual it will mean the end of their travels altogether. Join the rich, the famous and the resort staff to decipher the clues and catch a culprit in the act of killing!

This mystery is formatted to be able to be run indoors or out! Perfect for pool parties, summer BBQs, beach parties, you name it!

The package includes:


A Host Guide— A complete how-to of throwing your party which includes directions on preparing the invitations, assigning characters and preparing for the party.

29043.description:
Rather unusual soccer game: 11 players for both teams, but no ball and dice included!

Movements can be done in every direction as far as wanted, but several areas on the board can hold a limited number of players only. Goals are scored by moving a player on a free space of the goal, when that player is within the shooting area.
29043.name: 3:2...Sieg!

29044.description:
Issued in Switzerland by Tip Verlag Basel (publisher of the Swiss sports magazine "Tip") on the occasion of the 1958 Soccer World Cup in Sweden.

The two teams consist each of 1 goalkeeper, 2 defenders and 8 normal players.

The game's name "Fussball-Schach" (= soccer chess) is not very adequate, although no dice are used in this game. Unlike chess, all 11 players move the same way. However, the goal keeper must stay in his goal and the 2 defenders cannot leave their own half of the field.

Movements can be done as far as wanted and movements with 2 players in one turn are also possible. There are some rules included, which preclude having the ball totally surrounded by players. The most unusual (and surprisingly simple) of these rules is the rule that; the ball always moves 1 space further than a player.
29044.name: GOAL Fussball-Schach

29045.name: Hattrick
29045.description:
Hattrick is a fast-paced soccer card game with 89 cards:

- 60 team player cards (4 x 15 per team: England, Germany, Switzerland, Brazil)
- 6 all-star player cards
- 8 interrupt cards
- 5 punishment cards
- 3 special cards
- 5 goal cards
- 2 rule cards

The player cards are either goalkeepers, defenders, midfielders or attackers. The 4 teams have different numbers of each of these player card types.

The game is played with an imaginary ball on a imaginary soccer field with 4 parts: the goal room, the defense, the midfield and the attacking sector, assuming that the players always stay in their sector.

Every turn, a player can play 1 card more than his opponent has played in his previous turn, but these cards must be from the same team (all-stars are used as jokers). Anyway, the first card must always be a card that "stops" the ball.

A goal is scored, when an attacker can't be stopped with an appropriate card.

29046.name: Monopoly: Library Edition
29046.description: From notes from Games Gone By: This quite rare Edition of Monopoly was produced in 1961 in both a Wooden Box and a Plastic Box version.

29048.name: Jetsons Out of This World Game
29048.description: This 1962 Transogram Game is a simple roll and move game which also featured the playing of cards which were accumulated by landing on particular spots on the board. Game included playing pieces for George Jetson who worked for Spacely Space Sprockets, his wife Jane Jetson, teenage daughter Judy and preteen son Elroy. The housekeeper Rosie the Robot and the family dog Astro. On the show Astro could mumble words. His catch phrases were "Ruh-roh!" and "Right, Reorge!"

29049.name: Biddy Basketball
29049.description: Logan's Biddy Basketball Game (number 305) was an all metal construction game with a double scoreboard. The game came with 2 balls, 2 flippers and a large 25" by 40" court made of a vinyl like material. The game featured a standing basket with a net. Object of the game was to use the flippers to shoot balls into your basket.

29050.name: Devine ce que je mime?
29050.description:
A game where a player spins the arrow and picks a card of the indicated category. He must then mime what is shown on the card and the other players have to guess. The first one to guess right gets the card. The player with the most card wins. Can be played in teams. From 5 years old.

There are four categories :
- Qui suis-je ? (Who am I?)
- Que fais-je ? (What am I doing?)
- Quel animal suis-je ? (What animal am I?)
- Qu'est-ce que c'est ? (What is it?)

29051.name: The Best Quiz Night in the World
29051.description:
A 'quiz night' is a team trivia game, often played in British pubs on a certain night of the week. The Best Quiz Night in the World is a boxed game used to set up quiz nights, either in pubs/bars or scaled to parties or larger gatherings. According to the box, the game can be played with "1 to 1000" players.

The box includes a question disc, a sand timer, Joker and "sin bin" tokens, instruction book, and four pads and pencils.

Both US and UK versions of the game were published.

29053.name: Between the Boards Indoor Soccer
29053.description:
Between The Boards Indoor Soccer brings you the action and excitement of the old Major Indoor Soccer League (1978-1992).

A Fast Action Card (FAC) deck and team charts are all you need to play this fast-paced game. The FACs control all aspects of game play. Teams are rated for their offensive and defensive ability, their ability to draw penalties, and their power play and penalty killing.

Players are rated on their scoring, passing, and penalty abilities. Goalkeepers are rated as to saves and breaking up 2-on-1 chances.

The game has everything ... penalties, penalty kicks, bank shots off the dasher boards, goalkeeper assists and penalties. The FAC deck keeps play moving right along ... a complete game, plus stats, can be done in as little as 15 minutes once a familiarity with the game exists.

29054.name: Rose Petal Place
29054.description:
A light and simple game for children Ages 4 and up. Each player is a flower. Play cards in various combinations to advance along the board track and pickup teardrops. When everyone has reached the end of the track, count teardrop points. The winner is the player with the highest total.

From the rules:
ROSE-PETAL is trapped and is very unhappy in NASTINA's overgrown weed garden. It's up to the flowers to find her along the trail of teardrops, and save her from this unhappiness with sunshine and tears. But watch out for NASTINA! She'll try to stop you every chance she gets. The flower who cries the most magic tears wins.

Based on the children's toys and animated series Rose Petal Place.

29055.name: Down in Flames: Locked-On
29055.description:
Down in Flames: Jets brings the Down In Flames system to the jet age, by adding missile combat and range.

The "one hit one kill" sudden death nature of modern combat, makes this game very different than earlier versions of Down In Flames!

Multiple campaigns from the 1970s through modern day give players a variety of scenarios. During these campaigns, players will perform air combat missions to escort their strike aircraft to the target.

Down in Flames: Jets provides the fast-paced feel of air combat developed during the other games in the series, with streamlined rules and an intuitive, fast-playing game system.

Aircraft included in the game: Harrier, Phantom, Tomcat, Eagle, Fighting Falcon, Hornet, MiG-21, MiG-23, MiG-29, Corsair II, Intruder, Aardvark, Su-22, and many more.

29056.name: Louise Mandrell's Country Music Trivia Game
29056.description: Basic roll-and-move trivia game with a country music theme (and endorsed by Louise Mandrell). Players answer questions about country music or otherwise follow the instructions of the spaces they land on.

29057.name: Code Monkey
29057.description:
Code Monkey is a cute short game based on the song of the same name by Jonathan Coulton. Be the first Code Monkey to win the heart of the Pretty Receptionist and complete two projects for Boring Manager Rob.

The game is print and play. Print it onto form feed business cards, the 10 to a page kind you can get at most office supply stores. Separate then play.

Code Monkey is a fun game of corporate simians in love for 2-5 players.

All the good art was done by Len "Jawbone" Peralta.

The game is under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike licence.

29058.name: Super Mario Bros. GuraGura Game
29058.description: 3 Mario games in one. In one mode, you play a basic balance game as you try to place figures on a tower without having it topple. The other game utilizes a launcher to fling your characters at targets.

29059.name: The End is Near
29059.description:
The End is Near bills itself as "the hilarious game of doom-and-gloom cults."

Players take the role of somewhat outlandish prophets who have received a vision of the end of the world sometime between 1991 and 2000. In order to "win," you must have the most converts in your cult when the world ends (or, if the world somehow makes it past 2000, at the end of the game).

Players perform various (dice-determined) actions to raise cash and/or gain converts each turn, as well as reacting to signs and using event cards to hamper other cults' progress -- all the while keeping one eye on the calendar...

29060.name: Phantoms
29060.description: Phantoms is a quick and easy modern air combat game covering air combat from 1960 to the present.

29061.name: Mig Alley
29061.description:
Early Jet Air Combat By David Schueler MiG Alley Ace is a quick and easy jet air combat game pre missile air combat from 1945.

Check it at: http://www.warflag.com/mustangs/rules.html

29062.name: Match of the Day Electronic Trivia Game
29062.description:
Show your skill by answering football trivia questions & be the highest scoring team when full time is reached & the referee's whistle blows.

Includes over 1700 questions & an Electronic scoreboard !

29063.name: Le compte est bon!
29063.description:
This game is based on a famous French TV show in the 80ties called "Des chiffres et des lettres" (=numbers and letters).

Players are given 6 random numbers between 1-25. The object is by using basic mathematics (add/subtract/multiply/divide) to calculate a given three-figure number. After a preset amount of time players show their results. The one coming closest wins (that round).

If the result was correct, the TV presenter Jammot said his famous quote: "Le compte est bon!" which means the calculation was correct.

29064.name: King David: Miniature Battles in the Old Testament Period
29064.description:
King David: Miniature Battles in the Old Testament Period is a set of simple rules for wargaming the Battles of the Bible and other wars of the Ancient Near East up through the era of Troy.

The game is scaled for 15mm miniatures but is easily adapted to 25/28mm figures by converting centimeters to inches.

Game features include random terrain generation, pre-plotted hidden deployment, propitiatory acts, ambushes, variable initiative and movement determination, missile and melee combat, Heroes and Generals.

Army Lists are included for nineteen armies including multiple periods for peoples such as Israelites and Egyptians. Unit types include Heavy and Light chariots, Heavy and Light infantry, a variety of missile troops, Cavalry, Camelry and a number of culture-specific troop types.

Individual unit initiative rolls make for a freewheeling and unpredictable game.

29065.name: Raumapeli
29065.description: A variant of Monopoly that's placed in the Finnish city Rauma.

29067.name: JAMES BOND 007 Agenttipeli
29067.description: 10 nuclear warheads are missing. There are six international terrorist groups and your mission is to find out who are guilty ones.

29068.name: Rek
29068.description: Rek is a traditional game of Cambodia played on an 8x8 board. Each side has a king and 15 men, each of which moves as the rook in international chess. The object of the game is to capture the opposing king. There are two ways to capture: 1) move so as to immobilize one or more enemy men; 2) move between two enemy men that are on an orthogonal line and are separated from each other by a single square.

29069.name: Shoot Out
29069.description:
PICK YOUR PERFECT F.A. PREMIER LEAGUE DREAM TEAM!

Shoot Out gives you the chance to manage your very own team of F.A. Premier League Stars. Your decisions as manager will make the difference between winning and losing.

--From Rules Sheet

The goal of Shoot Out is to select a team of footballers whose values out-score your opponent's. Players secretly select 3 lines of players (Goalkeeper + Defenders/Midfielders/Strikers), each with a value of 1 to 4. The total of each line is calculated, with bonuses given to players of the same team sharing the same line, special abilities, or simply playing in their proper position. Strikers totals are compared to opposing Defenders totals, and Midfielders are compared to one another. The side that wins 2 out of the 3 point comparisons is the winner. This game is collectible, with player cards available in booster packs. Single cards are available for purchase from the game manufacturer.

A version of this game, featuring the Dutch Eredivisie (titled All Stars), also exists.

29070.name: Symbolix
29070.description:
The Symbolix, a gang of computer viruses, disguised as Smileys, are taking over the Web. Create the antivirus and save the Internet!
A Scientix is there to assist you, but he's easily influenced and may turn against you. Be alert and adapt your strategy.
Whatever happens, Zorg and Zorga, a couple of former hackers, will always be there to help you in your quest.

Contents:

66 tiles
6 cards
1 board
6 colors




Home Page: http://www.symbolix.fr/

29071.name: Bootlegger
29071.description:
Bootlegger is a bridge-like partnership trick-taking game with a few twists on the familiar theme. The deck consists of four suits with six wild "Bootlegger" cards. The latter may be played to any trick and cause the lowest (rather than highest) card to take the trick.

Instead of the traditional bid/pass, a player may "Inkle," which is a non-bid signal to partner that one can support a certain suit. A "Nullo" is a No Trump bid to take no tricks.

Teams score points (40 to 520, depending on the suit and number of tricks bid) for making their bid, or lose points if they fail. Play is to 500 points.

29072.name: Advertentiespel
29072.description:
This is a very simple game where you make fun with strange advertisements. The game consists of 3 decks of cards, one for each line of a 3 line advertisement. The current player picks up one card from each of the decks and reads them out loud. Because the lines usually do not make any sense together, this will hopefully make everyone laugh. And now the next player can draw and read. So there is no competition in this game, making it hardly a game at all.

Here are some examples of advertisements (drawing them as I write):

Tomorrow big sale: very good flycatcher, with use of bathroom.
Gentlemen searches: A nurse, extremely sticky.
Who helps me with: A tasty sausage, in a nickel cage.




This game has been quite popular in the fifties in the Netherlands.

boardgamehonor.21260: 2011 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "9 years and up" Nominee

29073.description:
The goal is to have the fewest number of groups of tiles on the board at the end of the game.

The players take turns placing one of their five tiles on a 9x9 grid and then draw another tile to replace it. There are three tiles which each player can place on each space: a letter, a number, or the item which represents the 3x3 sector of the board the space is in.

If another player has placed a tile it may be captured by playing a legal tile in its place, only if removing the tile doesn't break a group of tiles belonging to the player into more than one group. If players tie for the fewest number of groups at the end of the game, then the winner is the one who captured the fewest opponents' tiles.
29073.name: Blockers!

29074.name: Short Circuit: The Computer Energy Game
29074.description:
Short Circuit, the game where players using Strategic Planning, Timing and Luck, accumulate and acquire energy. Software, and money, which, when used in conjunction with their computers, interact throughout the period of play to create an exciting climax where one player (or in the case of a Partnership Play, a pair) triumphs.

Although some players accumulate more rapidly than others, the game is designed to permit "out of luck" players the chance to recover and possibly win the game.

A number of strategies may be employed while playing. These strategies will become apparent to players as they experience the Challenge of Short Circuit!

29075.name: Peacock Game
29075.description:
The game board is marked with four studios: News, Sports, Western and Music, plus the NBC Peacock in the center. Players move along the pathways to collect the 5 puzzle pieces of the Peacock by visiting spaces with matching pictures. If players marker stops on a space showing a picture of a part of the Peacock, he takes the matching piece from the pool and uses it to build his Peacock. First player to build a complete NBC Peacock from the puzzle pieces in the Pool is the Winner.
A trip trough television land. The fast-moving game of color matching and observation. Ages 5-10.
Under license from NBC-TV.

29076.name: Merry-Go-Round
29076.description: A spin and move game for 2 to 4 players Ages 5 and up. The goal is to be the first to get to the circus, but the race is complicated by the spinning plastic hill in the center. When you land on a space that allows you to turn the hill, you might have the opportunity to send your opponent off in a different direction, or you might help him get to the circus faster.

29077.name: Bay City Rollers On Tour
29077.description:
A game for 2-5 players, the winner is the first to arrive at the concert hall in the centre of the sheet.

Before arriving at the concert, each player must have collected four items, pictured on the Concert Entry Cards: a tartan scarf, an autograph book, a Bay City Roller's LP & a concert ticket.

B-A-Y, B-A-Y,
B-A-Y, C-I-T-Y,
With an R-O-double-L, E-R-S,
Bay City Rollers are the best!

Rare to find this game complete & in such good condition !

29078.description:
In the confines of the Pacified Empire of Humanity, the Legion of Democracy brings the marvelous concept of democracy to alien races. Poor creatures who do not know the treasures that our way of life can bring often confront the brave soldiers. In the name of the struggle against the Axis of Evil, our legionnaires have sworn loyalty and obedience to our Emperor, leader and divine inspiration, and fight for the triumph of the law, peace and the Holy Scriptures!

Those who do not stand with us, stand against us!
In the confines of the Zirl galactic hub, the tachyonic combat applets valiantly weather the assaults of the infamous totalitarian terran forces. The brave nanosoldiers courageously fight against the terran brutes who do not suspect the extent of the riches of our antediluvian civilization.

Those who do not stand with us, stand against us!
Take command of your units, terran or alien, and get ready for war!

Frontiers is a strategy game in which you lead your units on a futuristic battlefield. The game mechanics are geared for simple fun: orbital bombardment, short-ranged missile fire, hosing down your opponents with uranium-enriched ammunition, head-on and manly assaults in the name of humanity's religious purity.

In short, Frontiers is a simple and spontaneous mix of fury, blood and strategy!

Frontiers - the miniatures game without miniatures...
29078.name: Frontiers

29079.name: Lion Squad
29079.description: A two page wargame designed for a now dead contest. Lion squad is about a battle that took place on Mars in 2200 between the future king and rebels. Soldiers from the Kings army (Lion and Hearts) had to defend the outskirts of the city from the invading rebels, who were using a quickly built but unrefined tank.

29080.description:
Twelve Men's Morris is a traditional board game similar to Nine Men's Morris. It was most popular during the Middle Ages when it was played in courts across Europe. It is played on a board with 24 nodes joined by lines; each player has twelve pieces. The game proceeds in three phases:


Players alternately place one piece on a node in each move. If a player makes three in a row, he or she can capture one of the opponent's pieces.
Once all the pieces are placed, players take turns moving the pieces to adjacent nodes. Again, whenever a player forms three in a row, one of the opponent's pieces may be captured.
When one player is down to just three pieces, the remaining pieces may "fly" to anywhere on the board (not just adjacent nodes).


You win when you reduce your opponent to two pieces, or when he or she can't move.

Two possible boards exist.
One has three concentric squares marked with the mid-points of the adjacent sides of the the squares linked and also the adjacent corners linked. This is known as "small board Twelve Men's Morris".

The other board has four concentric squares marked, and similar to Nine Men's Morris, has only the mid-points of the adjacent sides of the the squares linked. This is known as "large board Twelve Men's Morris".
29080.name: Twelve Men's Morris

29081.name: L'exposition doit continuer!
29081.description: A game for four players, each player takes on the role of an actor or actress, and their goal is to stay alive. All the other players are attempting to kill you in order to get into the spot light, and steal the show!

29082.description: An expandable hex and counter wargame where terrain plays a huge factor in the actions and reactions of the units.
29082.name: Man Versus Nature (And some Guns)

29083.description: Pick one of eight fictional teams in England and lead them to a victorious football season. Using two pages, one for counters and one for a map you will have to attempt to manage your team in the most effective manner while keeping an eye on your cash flows.
29083.name: English Soccer Manager: Two Page Wars

29084.description: Air traffic controller is a logic based game in which you must manage an airport. Each turn you can make one command to an aircraft. Each aircraft then follows that command until another one is issued. Throughout the game new aircraft are taking off or landing, so managing the space on the tarmac is extremely important.
29084.name: Air Traffic Controller

29085.name: Economic Gears
29085.description: Economic gears is a game based in a fantasy world which is used to teach and learn about economic functions in society. During each turn players are allowed to place new tiles to grow the allowed economic area of the game. Furthermore each player takes part in the economic success of the new nation by building up a transportation empire to move the newly discovered goods.

29086.description: In an alternate Europe six nations compete to gain the upper hand in economic and military power. Using a territory movement system, and an in depth economic guide players attempt to compete with the other six players while finishing the goals given to them. (Game also includes an expansion which adds North America into the mix!)
29086.name: Last one Left

29087.description: A fantasy based wargame in which two nations go to war. One comes from the desert with fast horsemen, while the other is entangled in a civil war while attempting to fight off the enemy.
29087.name: MIP #17: The Lost Fantasy Game

29088.description: Boarding actions in the skies of space 1889's Mars with mini-scale deckplans, cardstock minis, rules, and ship diagrams.
29088.name: Cloudships & Gunboats

boardgamefamily.7757: From RPG books to board games

29089.name: Labirinto de Creta
29089.description: On a round board, try to move 5 balls to the center of the labyrinth, without let any of them fall from the border.

29091.name: Whatchamacallit Word Game
29091.description:
A new concept in word games with the great advantage of involving all the players in the fun of the game all of the time. The game can be played by the whole family & by any number of players.

The game centres around the planners or plans. These are the 'Crosswords' made up by all the players before the play actually begins. These planners are filled out by each player in crossword fashion on a particular theme or subject eg. Film Stars, The Sea, Sport etc & the rest of the players have to find the words in these plans - the player with the most points being the winner.

A game concept that can grow & even use tiles from other word games !

29092.name: Picco Camillo
29092.description:
From the editor:
Camillo and his 11 friends love parties and are keen to take part in whatever is going on.

But they never come without invitation: the coloured faces on the spinning top show which friend may come. But watch out: some symbols on the top bring unexpected surprises with them, making the game exciting to the very end! Let Camillo and his friends bring a real party mood into your playroom.

29093.description:
Players race, using the shortest routes possible, through more than 100 cities of The Netherlands and adjacent areas in Germany and France. The first player to return to his starting point wins the game.

Contents (1985 edition):

1 board, 1 six-sided die, 6 flags, 6 pawns, 74 place cards, 55 numbered cards for places with attractions, 18 luck cards, 3 reserve cards, rules with information on the 55 tourist attractions
29093.name: Een Reis Door Nederland

29094.name: Würfel Kick
29094.description:
A football (soccer) board game produced and published by Ravensburger Germany just before the World Cup 2006. Each player has only one pawn (pl. piece) and 3 six-sided dice. The dice are used to move the pl. piece, but:

The first die has this value 1,2,2,3,3,4
The second 1,2,3,4,5,fault
The third 2,4,6,6,fault,fault -> (long running but 33% of chances to get the fault side of the die)




Who scores first 3 goals is the winner...

The board of the game is like a football stadium, with some lines and holes for the pl.pieces movements.

29095.description:
From the publisher's blog:

This will be our first two Specialist packs: a Dwarven Battalion and a Goblin Skirmishers set. These packs introduce new units to the game, along with the Specialist and Weapon summary cards necessary to field them. For now, let’s just say that they will significantly alter your game.

Contents:

4 Iron Dwarf Bagpipers
8 Iron Dwarf Spear Bearers (16 more are found in BattleLore: Scottish Wars)
8 Iron Dwarf Axe Swingers (8 more are found in BattleLore: Bearded Brave)
14 banners
2×1 Green Bagpiper
2×1 Blue Bagpiper
2×1 Red Bagpiper
2×2 Axe Swingers
2×2 Spear Bearers

4-page Rules booklet with 2 new adventures
3 Specialist cards (Iron Dwarves Axe Swingers, Bagpipers, Spear Bearers)
3 Weapon Summary cards (Bagpiper, Battle Axe, Spear Bearer)




Expands:

BattleLore
29095.name: BattleLore: Dwarven Battalion Specialist Pack

29096.description: A simple cardgame by Bruno Faidutti, totally based on bluff. Players try to move their 5 treasures in one of their ships, but only two of their five ships can be armed with cannons. Who can bluff their way across the oceans while opponents try to send pirates to attack unprotected ships?
29096.name: Letter of Marque

29097.name: Subbuteo Free Kick
29097.description:
Subbuteo Free Kick is a football (soccer game). It focuses on set pieces. The attacking player flicks his Player to chip the ball into the goal using a ramp. The defending player positions a three man wall and operates the goalkeeper on a stick to defend the free kick. The first to five goals wins.

A self contained game, it is designed to encourage younger players to build their skills ready for the full Subbuteo game. Promotional version available in conjunction with Nestle Yorkie.

29098.name: Political Capital: The Economist board game
29098.description:
A pull-out game from the Christmas 1998 issue of The Economist magazine.

Each player represents the leader of a country. Every leader wants to stay in power for longer than any of his peers--that's what it takes to win. To achieve this you need to manage your political-capital points. The to and fro of normal political life will eat into your capital--but good judgment, good luck and well timed elections can replenish it.

29099.name: Pola Naftowe
29099.description: Pola Naftowe is a Polish game about building and running oil companies. The players build their oil empires by buying oil-tankers, oil wells and refineries. The main game mechanism is auction - players sell oil in the two sessions of stock-market. The game lasts for five rounds, player with the biggest amount of money at the end is the winner.

29100.name: Milwaukee in a Box

647.name: Late for the Sky Production Company

boardgameversion.91220: Late for the Sky Production Company edition

29100.description:
A Monopoly-style game from Late For The Sky publishing which uses a thematic setting of Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

Summer Fest and The Great Circus Parade are the utilities in this game, and property cards cover places like the Bradley Center, County Stadium, Miller and Pabst Brewing Companies, Harley-Davidson, Usinger's Sausage, the Pfeister Hotel, and the Allen-Bradley Clock Tower.

The tokens which are unique to this edition are a pewter mug of beer with a frosty head on it, a pretzel, a baseball glove, a snowman, a sailboat, and one other item (not sure about which one it was)...

Peruse Water Street, sail in Lake Michigan, visit the zoo, or BOWL! All centered around a nice graphic of the tower of Milwaukee's historic City Hall.

29101.name: Succession
29101.description:
For 3-4 players

Background : This game is not meant to be historical by nature. Instead it is a very rough sketch into political maneuvering and backstabbing used to get people into high positions of power. Since it is not historical, in the process of designing no real names were used. Even though some cards have images on them of famous people, they do not mean or correspond to anything (instead they are merely a card.)

Goal : At the end of the game who ever has the MOST of their color at the front of the line wins the game.

29102.description: A game about the Battle of Vimeiro. Included are the counters and maps you will need to play the game. This is part of the Historical Series of free war-games for paperworlds.com (Now defunct). Overall this is an abstract look at the battle fought between the British and French in Portugal.
29102.name: Battle of Vimeiro

29103.description: A small and light game about elite units who forcefully retake space ships from pirates. Game is on a level of individual combat.
29103.name: Space Squads

29104.description:
Wicked Narrows covers the Roman disaster in the Teutoburg Forest on September 9th, 2 A.D. Led by one of Rome’s favorite son’s, German born Arminius, turned on those that loved and trained him, leading four German tribes (18000 men) into deadly battle with Varus’ Roman Army. The German ambush at the Kalkriese Narrows ( a narrow strip of land only 220m wide) caught the Romans by complete surprise with an am-bush. One the 2nd day, all 20000 Romans had been killed. This game focuses on the second day as the Romans approached the narrows and the German attack !

The map scale is about 550 yards per hex. Each combat unit is a cohort of 500 men for the Roman and between 500-1000 men for the German. A game turn represents one hour of time.

The design is unique and captures the flavor of battle during this period. The game depends upon the German player and when he launches his devastating attack. In fact, until the German attacks, the Romans simply casually march towards their destination. When the attacks begin, blood will spill across the map as the Romans try desperately try to maintain damage control. But this is hard, as the German tribes create an attack like a shark frenzy, which only continues to become more barbaric!

The battle sequence contains three rounds of types of combat, leaders and morale are vital and is impacted by what happens in the combat rounds.

One 11x17 Map, rules, 280 counters. Still only $16.00. Designed by Kerala Cironi. Developed by Perry Moore.
29104.name: Wicked Narrows: Rome's Disaster at Kalkreis, Sept 9, 2 A.D.

29105.name: Royal Battles
29105.description:
Royal Battles is a strategic board game of small scale battles played with playing cards and chess pieces. In Royal Battles players compete to defeat each other in head-to-head combat. Each player builds an army of 4 units (represented with chess pieces) and maneuvers them on a battle board made from a tile grid of playing cards. Each unit has a special ability that sets it apart and it is the combination of units and abilities that will determine the difference between victory and defeat.

Requires playing cards (standard poker or bridge decks) and chess pieces.

29106.description:
Roll the special Letter Roll dice and flip over the timer. Players race to list words containing the three letters shown on the dice. Only words listed by a single player score points, so players are rewarded for both their speed and creative thinking.

Components

Seven polyhedral dice (20-sided?).
The color of the dice indicate how frequently their letters appear in English:
2 white dice – frequently used letters
3 blue dice – less frequently used letters
2 orange dice – infrequently used letters
1 two-Minute timer for the standard game
1 one-Minute Timer for the fast-play game
Four pads and four pencils

Gameplay

Decide whether to use the short or long timer. One player chooses 4 of the 7 dice and rolls them. The player to their left removes a die of their choice. Players then write down all words they can think of which contain the remaining 3 letters and any number of other letters. When time is up, word lists are read and you must cross out any word which someone else has used. Your remaining unique words are your points. All 7 dice are then passed to the next player and the process is repeated. Each person rolls 1 to 3 times, depending on the number of players, at which point whoever has the most points wins.

For younger players use fewer and easier dice; for expert players use 4 dice instead of 3 and set a limit on the minimum number of letters that a word must contain.

Note: before starting, players may want to decide whether to change the rule that allows repeating the same root word. For example, if played as written, cheat, cheats, cheated, cheating, cheater are all allowed.
29106.name: Letter Roll

29107.description:
From the Rules book:

The Shepherdess, her sheep and dog must return under cover in the sheepfold before the wind takes away the bridge.
Will the players manage to cooperate in taking all the sheep back to the sheepfold

La bergère, ses moutons et son chien doivent rentrer à l'abri dans la bergerie avant que le vent n'emporte le pont.
Les joueurs parviendron-ils à coopérer pour ramener tous les moutons à la bergerie ?

Die Schafhirtin, ihre Schafe und ihr Hütehund müssen in den schützenden Schafsstall gelangen, bevor der Wind die Brücke mitnimmt.
Shaffen es die Spieler zusammenzuarbeiten, um alle Schafe in den Schfstall zu bringen ?
La pastora, sus ovejas y su perro tienen que volver a refugiarse al refugio antes de que el viento sa lleve el puente por los aires.
Podràn cooperar los jugadores para llevar a todas las ovelas de vuelta al refugio ?

Ages 4 and up.
29107.name: Hop! Hop! Hop!

29108.name: Johnny and the Toe-Sap Fungus
29108.description:
Long ago on a small island lived a tribe with a problem. For as long as they could remember each member of the tribe had been infected with the dreaded toe-sap fungus. With every step taken, a small droplet of toe-sap would ooze from each toe. This, of course, was a constant source of shame to the tribe members.
