Each player has a number of cards in his hand representing Police Notices of stolen goods or missing cars, and the corresponding items are on cards placed face down in various locations on the board. A player passing through such a location may examine the card and if he has a matching Police Notice may take it and place it in front of him. Players may pick up further police notices by visiting police stations.

When all the cards have been claimed, the player who has recovered the highest value wins.
29246.name: The Junior Police Five Game

29247.description:
Now you can test your World Cup football knowledge wherever you go! This handy pack contains 600 questions. You can play it anywhere as a stand-alone game using the special die or add questions to your standard Trivial Pursuit! Includes questions on players, teams, rules and regulations, fans, World Cup, trophies and more!

This is another in the "Bite-Size" range of Trivial Pursuit games. It is intended as a portable travel game. The game is packaged in a wedge ("piece-of-pie") shaped box.

The game does not feature a game board, and thus, there is no roll-and-move mechanic. Instead, players roll the color-coded die, and answers a question matching the color rolled. If a player correctly answers a question, he may "go for a wedge" by answering another question in the same category. If he does so, he keeps that card. If the player answers a question incorrectly, it is the next player's turn. Play ends when a player has collected six cards/correctly answered 12 questions.
29247.name: Trivial Pursuit: World Football – Bite-Size

29248.name: Esploriamo il Sistema Solare
29248.description:
On a board depicting the Solar System, 2 to 6 players are racing to run a complete tour of the planets, starting from a space station located near the sun (!) and returning to it after countering the gravitational attraction of the planets, the Asteroids fields printed on the map and three giant rock counters blocking the path.
One set of movement special dice and one deck of event cards are included.
A nice variant of the Goose game to be played with kids.

29249.name: Super Sale
29249.description:
Components:
4-piece jigsaw style board
30 sale cards
4 pawns
1 die

The board represents a clothing store holding a sale. Players move their pawns around the store by rolling the die. Lift spaces allow short cuts between the 'floors'. There are eight types of item on sale in different areas of the board. Landing on a 'BUY' square allows a player to take an item represented by a price-ticket showing retail price / sale price / saving.

Players have a maximum of £30 to spend and may exit the store once they have spent £25. The player who exits first gets a £2 bonus for his parking fee and ends the game.

Players score the savings amounts made plus bonuses for suits - jacket and trousers or skirt and jumper - plus cash in hand. Player with the highest score is the winner.

29250.name: Mike Read's Pop Quiz Game
29250.description:
Form a pop group, make a record and be the first to Number One in the charts by a combination of luck and answering Mike Read's Pop Quiz questions.

The game is played in two parts. In the first part players roll the dice to move their 'guitarist' piece around the outer track and collect a pop group of six cards comprising: Lead Guitarist, Bass Guitarist, Keyboard Player, Drummer, Vocalist, and P.A. In the second part players instead move their guitarist piece around the inner track and also move their 'record' piece up and down the charts. The squares on the inner track either have the players answering pop music related questions (in the general form of "Name X bands/titles with this <word> in the title" or drawing a card and following the instructions. A sand timer is used for the easy questions (30 seconds) and hard questions (60 seconds).

The first player to have their record piece reach Number One in the charts wins the game.

29251.name: Super Series Baseball
29251.description:
Super Series Baseball is a game that uses dice to simulate the positions on the field and the pitches.

The pitcher die is thrown, showing the kind of pitch (curve, knuckleball etc) and a number (1-6). The batter then choses the die shown on the pitcher die, a fastball is a 1, and that die is rolled. The result of that die shows what happened on the pitch.

There are 9 dice for the defensive team, one for each position, 6 batting team dice and 9 pawns, used to simulate batters and count the balls, strikes, runs and outs. The game also includes a board and a deck of scorecards.

boardgamecompilation.19322: Star Fleet Battles: Module Omega 1 – The Omega Sector

29252.description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

As described by ADB, the original 2007 release of the Omega Master Rulebook contained over 320 pages (bagged, loose leaf, with a black-and-white cover) and contained every rule, chart, scenario, and ship description from the first four Omega modules; Omega tactics; updated sequence of play listing, including the entire Alpha Octant, the simulator empires, and the Lesser Magellanic Cloud; completely updated Annex #7E, Damage Conversion Chart; all ship descriptions and scenarios for the Omega Octant that were published in Captain's Log; and the "lost" history section originally written for Module Omega 4.

ADB presented this as the relaunch of the Omega Octant setting, with future Omega modules in development.

In 2011, a revised edition of the Omega Master Rulebook was released in print and on e23. With its page count brought up to 422 pages, this update integrates additional rules and R-section information (most notably those from SFB Module Omega 5), as well as scenarios and tactical primers published in issues of Captain's Log between the original 2007 edition of the OMRB and this update.
29252.name: Star Fleet Battles: Omega Master Rulebook

29663.name: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set

29253.name: Kunst & Kennis Spel: The Art & Expertise Game of the Rijksmuseum
29253.description: This Dutch/English language game, made in Holland, is a cross between a trivia game and the old game Masterpiece. Players answer questions about 100 paintings in the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam, and then use their points to add the painting to a collection, careful that it may be a forgery.

29254.name: Quiz & Lode
29254.description:
The game is a trivia set, in Italian, for kids in elementary school and junior high. Six sets are available, from 1st to 6th grade.
Each set includes 1150 questions and answers divided in 7 main arguments:

. comics and cartoons
. Italian and English
. nature and hobbies
. riddles and enigmas
. math and information technology
. space and time
. sport

The questions are presented in groups of ten printed on nice strip cards packaged in a handy system.

29255.name: Opplev Norge-spillet
29255.description: Travel across Norway and answer questions relating to various places and cities you stop at. Everybody starts at Lindesnes. Roll of the die determines where you go from there, but everybody follows the roads printed on the map. If you answer correctly you get to move 2 steps further and answer a bonus question. If you answer this correctly as well you get to roll the die again. The route splits in two at the city of Trondheim. A die roll determines which route you take. The first to get to Kristiansand and the Zoo wins.

29256.description: The game traces the development of early human species from 120,000 years ago through to the near-modern era. Players take the role of Peking Man, Archaic Homo Sapiens, Cro-Magnon, Neanderthal, or Homo Floresiensis, and each attempts to develop instincts and higher cortical brain functioning, such as language traits. The populations expand and collide, and eventually consciousness, society, and culture are sought after.
29256.name: Origins:  How We Became Human

29257.name: Field of Honour
29257.description:
This is a simple two player card game that is an abstract depiction of two armies facing each other on the battlefield. It can either be played as a simple two player card game, or as a sub-game to a more complex wargame – say a campaign where you wish to resolve minor battles without resorting to setting
out model soldiers.

Each game takes a couple of minutes, and only requires a standard pack of playing cards (with jokers).

29258.name: El Último Puente
29258.description:
El Último Puente (The Last Bridge), recreates the Battle of Arnhem. In 1944, in spite of being weakened, Germany remained a powerful enemy for the Allies. In order to breach the German resistance and access the Reich, only one entry was available from the Western front: the Netherlands.

This was to be the largest Allied airborne operation in the war: "Operation Market Garden".

(Translated from the game catalogue).

29259.description:
From Wizards website:

A sweeping conflict in the South Pacific where naval might leads to air superiority. Axis and Allies: Guadalcanal challenges you to control sea zones and island groups while managing troop and supply transport and directing land, sea, and air forces in one of the decisive campaigns of the Second World War's Pacific Theater.


Created by Larry Harris, designer of the Axis and Allies board game.
Incorporates crucial elements that were key factors in the historical campaign, such as air strip construction, troop and supply transport, and furious land, sea, and air battles.
Introduces the Cruiser unit as well as mechanics for land, sea and air combat in the South Pacific using a randomized casualties system.
Provides fans with the historical counterpoint to the World War II experience offered by Axis and Allies: Battle of the Bulge.


Note the following errata from the AH website:
The rulebook states that players get 5 reinforcement points, plus 2 per island they control. This is incorrect due to an error in the rulebook. The correct reinforcement scheme is that each player gets 10 reinforcement, plus 4 per island they control. The game is playable either way, but Avalon Hill recommends playing the correct way (10 and 4 per). We are sorry for any inconvenience this causes.
29259.name: Axis & Allies:  Guadalcanal

29260.name: Burgfried
29260.description:
Burgfried (Keep) puts one player in the role of defending a castle. The other one has to lay siege on it and capture the castle's keep. The game is mainly card based which mostly depict soldiers, siege machines and counter-measures for them. Soldiers can be used by both sides, while siege machines and counter-measures are obviously only useful for the attacker and defender respectively.
Gameplay is supported by a simple plan that shows the castle and the status (ok/destroyed) of its parts. The keep is the innermost part, so the attacker has to destroy several parts (e.g. moat, walls) before he can land the final blow. For each part a special action card and siege machine is needed. There is also a mechanism for starving the defender out.
After a game is won (attacker: starving out the defender or destroying the keep, defender: holding out for four weeks), roles switch.
The game was originally planned to be extensible, but I've never seen one. The main game is subtitled "Basis-Set: Ritter" (base set: knights).

29261.name: ¿Quién está ahi?
29261.description: Are the grandparents on the second floor? Is someone in the kitchen? Be the first in finding out where the other player’s family is and win the game.

29262.description:
One of the largest Napoleonic Battle using the La Bat system. (4) 22"x32" maps and 1000 counters. Includes scenarios and a strategic element.

The Battle itself was fought on July 5th and 6th, 1809 just at the end of Napoleon's Danube campaign. Napoleon himself lead his army against Austrian forces lead by the Archduke Charles.

La Bataille System:
scale = 100 m/hex;
time = 20 min/GT;
strength = 50-100 men/SP (Regimental/Brigade Size)
29262.name: La Bataille de Deutsch-Wagram

29263.name: CSI: The Board Game – Encore Edition
29263.description: This is essentially the same game as the original CSI: Crime Scene Investigation – The Board Game, but with 8 new cases to solve, new board & card graphics, and new random events. This is a completely stand-alone game: you do not need the earlier CSI game to play this one.

29264.description:
Lord Yar issued the command with a wave of his hand. With a surge his mounted knights leaped into the charge, their lances lowered, ready to trample and pierce their goblin foes under heavy warhorses.

With a scream the Warlock’s dragon plunged out of the clouds above the battlefield, dropping down onto the charging knights. Flames and death followed as the mounted warriors charge was broken by the great beast of scales and wing. The victory did not last long though, as the high lord Wizard cast a mighty lighting bolt to strike the dragon dead, it falling out of the skies and crashing into the front lines of the goblin hoards.

Lord Yar cringed at the carnage that was already sweeping over the battlefield. The two great mages would both continue to throw their forces at each other, cast spells and counter these magics with their own powerful spells. By the end of the day, Yar doubted that anyone would be left alive.

This is Mage Wars, the newest Mini-Game from Bad Baby Productions. Mage Wars is a fast, fun game of magical conquest and war. Can your forces defeat your rivals before they grind you under their boot? Fully expandable, the system will showcase two new mages with each edition, as well as new hex boards, troops, magic and more. Gathered together, these different editions will create a massive game system which will devour hours of your time, so be warned, this game can be additive.

This first set covers the forces and magic of the Arch-Mage and the Vile Warlock Lord. Each set comes with enough counters, map tiles and goodies to play, and when combined with other sets you can create a massive game system where several players can struggle for control of the magical realms of Mage War.
29264.name: Mage Wars: Call to Arms

29267.name: Party & Co: Girls
29267.description:
This is a game from the Party & Co family.
Party & Co Girls is the ideal game to spend a great time during a relaxing evening or a pajama party with your friends. Party & Co Girls have 5 different challenges:

dear diary - write a diary trying to hide 3 word in your story
travel bag - remember some objects in the right order
categories - give the more concepts you can in a certain category
celebrity hunting - 3 levels: a lot of words, 1 word, just charades
zapping - find an object in a tv channel, while the other team changes it




For ages 8+

29268.description: From the Party & Co family, This Party & Co - Junior game has been specially designed for kids. With 5 categories themed in kids world, it will bring a lot of fun to the little ones.
29268.name: Party & Co: Junior

29270.description:
The magistrate leaned back from his desk and sighed. He had so much to do and little time or money to get it all done. In his hand was a report of goblin raiders attacking farms to the north. On his desk where other requests for aid, complaints about bandits along the high road, undead shambling about a local graveyard and many more calls for aid.

Leaning forward the high magistrate called in his assistant, a small, frail looking man with small eyeglasses perched on his thin nose. “Yes milord?” the small man asked with a swift bow.

Handing the report on the goblin raiders to the his assistant, the Magistrate told him to give the job to, “That dwarf, what was his name? You know, the one that help us out with the troll some weeks back. He and his band of adventurers did a good job on that assignment, let us see how they fair with goblins.”

With a bow, the bespectacled man turned and left, calling for a runner to go find the dwarf, who know doubt was drunk in some tavern, rewarding himself with the gold he had earned on his last job for the city’s chief trouble shooter.

This is Heroes for Hire, the newest Mini-Game from Bad Baby Productions. Take the role of a city bureaucrat, as you seek to solve one problem after another. Most of your day-to-day dealing though, has to do with adventurers, their hiring and then sending them off to solve one of the many problems that plagues your city. Can you build up a stable of reliable heroes who will slay the dragon you need dead, or find the grand treasure that you need to offer as a wedding present to the king’s third cousin. Seek glory through the blood and sweat of others, and rise to the top position within the realm.
29270.name: Heroes for Hire

29271.description:
Jard gathered the mystical rune stones into his hand and threw them out into the air before him. As the stones flew into the mist filled night they stopped their flight and hung before the young wizard, spinning about each other in a magical dance. With the Runes now ready, Jord called the spell to mind and began to chant the rites of summoning. With a blast of multi-colored light and a puff of foul smelling smoke, a green furred wolf leaped out of the magical doorway the rune stones had opened. Standing nearly as tall as the short mage, the wolf growled and then bowed its head in obedience to its master.

Turning, Jord commanded the great wolf to leap at his foe, a minor conjurer who had challenged Jord to a duel. Jord only hoped that the wolf he had just summoned would be enough to finish the other mage off, as that was the last of Jord’s runes stones and so the end of his own magic.

This is Runes, a game of magical battle, spell casting and summoning. Can you out fight your foe, using the mystical rune stones and your chosen field of magic. A new and innovative game system, the Rune’s game system is fully expandable and compatible with other Runes games. So why wait, go out and find some adventure and play Runes.

The first set of this exciting game covers the magic of Sorcery and the elemental power of Water.

Do you dare step into the mystical worlds of Runes…
29271.name: Runes

29272.description:
Mini XiangQi is one of several small variants of Xiangqi (Chinese Chess). Each player has an army of 12 pieces (one General, two Knights, two Cannons, two Chariots, and five Soldiers); unlike the parent game, there are no Guards or Elephants. The rules are the same as XiangQi except that soldiers may move and capture one space to the side from their first move. There is no river to cross and no promotion. In addition, except for the General, no pieces are restricted to the fortress.

In the Leopard variant of Mini XiangQi, each player also has two leopards. Leopards move one space orthagonally or two spaces diagonally. They are allowed to capture only when making the two-space move. When making the two-space move, the leopard may jump over a piece (friendly or enemy) on the intervening point, although the jumped piece is not captured. Leopards are stronger pieces than elephants in standard XiangQi because they are capable of reaching any space on the board.
29272.name: Mini Xiang Qi

29273.name: Zhevezh Gauntlet
29273.description:
Zhevezh Gauntlet - A Dragonroar Adventure
Its the only supplement, for the fantasy miniatures combat system and RPG "Dragonroar". It includes maps, scenario description, an introductory audio tape, various character sheets.
It uses an introductory level system which emphasizes combat with various monsters. Hit points are shown as marked-off circles on a body diagram sheet.

29274.name: Rubbish
29274.description:
This is a simple sequence game with a challenge element.

There are 104 cards each marked with a letter. There are 4 of each letter of the English alphabet.

In the center of the table, there are 4 stacks - 2 ascending from A-Z, and 2 descending from Z-A. A "Higher/Lower" marker is placed between the piles.

In front of each player, there are 2 stacks - a face down draw pile and a face up discard pile.

At the start of the game, all cards are dealt to players, so the only stacks with cards are the player draw piles.

Cards must be played onto the stacks in sequence - D on top of C if going "Higher", C on top of D if going "Lower". Cards may also be played onto another player's discard pile if it is 1 higher or lower than the top card. A player's turn ends when he draws a card that cannot be played anywhere - it is then placed in his own discard pile.

The winner is the person who gets rid of all their cards first (discard piles are recycled).

Other players can challenge a move by shouting "Rubbish". All players give 1 card to a validly challenged player, or to the challenger if wrong.

To encourage a noisy game with lots of challenging, the rules suggested that players play quickly in order to make mistakes.

The game consists solely of the marker, the cards and the rules.

The rules say that whilst any number of players is possible, it is best with 4-10 players.

29275.description:
The Frank crushed the skull of the ghoul with an easy grip of he’s massive hand. Still as one died, five more appeared and rushed the mighty monster. With a howl of delight they began to rip at the Frank’s flesh with chipped teeth and dirty claws. One ghoul the Frank could handle, but five was a bit too much. With a mighty crash the ghouls brought the huge monster down to his knees, each feeding on his flesh as he screamed in rage.

This is Monster Bash, the newest game from Bad Baby Productions. Take on the role of a savage monster from classic horror tales, build gangs of these monsters and battle your foes as each tries to take control of the city’s dark, horror filled underworld. Gangs of monster confront each other in deadly brawls as each tries to devour the fear filled humans that flee through the night.

Monster Bash is a fully expandable system, with each set offering two new types of monstrous gang, new Battle Tiles to fight upon and new, exciting special abilities and rules. So gather a few friends, sit down and have a ghoulish night filled with monstrous fun.
29275.name: Monster Bash 2: Franks and Ghouls

29276.description:
D-Day is the first Campaign Book, covering from D-Day, 6 June 1944, to the liberation of Paris on 25 August 1944. It contains no army lists or specific unit descriptions but it does contain the following:


History of the Normandy Campaign
Rules for amphibious assaults
Rules for bocage fighting
Hit the Beach mission
Utah Beach scenario
Sword Beach scenario
Rules for Hobart’s Funnies
The Bréville Gap axis of attack campaign
Cutting the Cotentin axis of attack campaign
Normandy Modelling tips and ideas
29276.name: Flames of War: D-Day

11168.name: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

29278.description:
18Rhl-Rhineland is an 18xx railway game for 3 to 6 players. The concept is based on 1829 by Francis Tresham. The special features of 18Rhl-Rhineland are the bonus routes between steel mills and coal mines, the crossing of the river Rhine and the Rhinegold-Express. The latter achieves a very high income if it travels all the way from the Netherlands to Frankfurt or Basel.

18Rhl-Rhineland is a revision of 1838: Rheinland.

Players buy companies and stock in railroads in a effort to make more money than the other players. The winner of the game is the player with the highest net worth at game end.

A small expansion, sold with the copies sold at Essen one year, consisted of a special gray tile for Essen, containing both the city and $20 Krupps factory spot on one of the 6 legs which can be half of a Montan bonus run.
29278.name: 18Rhl: Rhineland

29279.name: Party & Co: Evolution
29279.description:
From the Party & Co family, Party & Co Evolution is made out of 5 different categories of games:

Brands
Mimic & Sounds
Trivia
Drawing
Taboo




The game includes:

1 Board
1 Note Pad
1 Pencil
1 sand clock
400 cards, each with 5 challenges)
4 tokens in the shape od CD player
20 CD tokens in 5 colors

29280.name: Party & Co: Gramola
29280.description: This is a game from the Party & Co family. The players will participate in teams, trying to beat the other teams in 5 great challenges. All the challenges are Music themed: songs, singers, music groups … Participate and show the others how much you like music.

29281.name: Party & Co: Original
29281.description:
With all the fun of Party & Co games, in 5 categories:

Charades
Taboo
Trivia
Lip reading
Drawing




The game comes with 2000 new questions, where speed and team play will be the keys of succeeding.

Ages 14 and up

29282.name: The Con Game
29282.description:
This is a "simulation" of fan experiences at an average science fiction convention. The rules and event cards are full of "old school" fannish in-jokes. After registering at the hotel and convention, you wander through four boards with the various function rooms of a convention hotel. Players gather Pleasure, Glory, Survival, and Embarrassment points by landing on any of 10 event spaces. You draw and read an event card and add the listed points to your score card.
The game ends when a) everyone gets tired of playing any longer, b) a pre-set time limit is reached, c) the Dorsai (see above) arrive, or d) Global Thermonuclear War breaks out. Event, Glory and Survival points are added and Embarrassment points subtracted. High score wins.
The game comes with ten sheets of event cards, 4 map boards, one sheet of cut and fold figures, a sheet of "Personal Convention Program Card & Tally Sheets, a "Fan Guest of Honor" Button, an 8-sided die and a rules pamphlet. All components are hand drawn or written. and have to be cut out for use. Blank event cards are also provided so you can add your own stories.

29283.description:
The vampire screamed in agony as the werewolf ripped at his chest, dead blood flying everywhere. The vampire though, was a tough foe and with a puff of smoke, turned into mist and floated away, only to return to its true form several steps beyond. With a sly grin the blood drinker raised its clawed hand and out of the sewer drain swarmed a vast carpet of rats. The moving rug of vermin swarmed the savage were-creature and soon it fell to the ground, howls of agony rising from the mound of filthy rats as they devoured the were-beast.

This is Monster Bash, the newest game from Bad Baby Productions. Take on the role of a savage monster from classic horror tales, build gangs of these monsters and battle your foes as each tries to take control of the city’s dark, horror filled underworld. Gangs of monsters confront each other in deadly brawls as each tries to devour the fear filled humans that flee through the night.

Monster Bash is a fully expandable system, with each set offering two new types of monstrous gang, new Battle Tiles to fight upon and new, exciting special abilities and rules. So gather a few friends, sit down and have a ghoulish night filled with monstrous fun.

This first set covers the monstrous gangs of the vampires and werewolves. Everything you need to play is included and when combined with other sets, you can create a horror filled game of nightmarish fun.

Integrates with:

Monster Bash 2: Franks and Ghouls
29283.name: Monster Bash: Bloods and Lupines

29284.description:
Culloden on Drummossie Moor, April 16, 1746. William Augustus, Duke of Cumberland, leads a new Government army loyal to the House of Hannover north to face Prince Charles Edward Stuart's fierce Highlanders. Bonnie Prince Charlie's Scots have been victorious in every encounter with the forces of the 'German Usurper' George II since the Jacobite flag of rebellion was raised at Glen Coe on August 19, 1745. Now as the fog lifts off the sodden moorland at 11 AM, 4500 claymore-armed clansmen, most having not eaten nor slept in a day and a half, stand to as the red-coated ranks of 9000 troops of the government army march into battle formations. As the cannon of both sides unleash grapeshot, the Duke orders his troops forward, confident in their fire discipline. The Scots, outnumbered 2 to 1 in bodies but possessing the spirit of a lion in every Celtic breast, launch themselves into an attack borne by their battle ferocity that has been victorious in every contest of arms for the past year. The throne of Britain has just been laid on the scales of combat.

Culloden contains:
one 11" by 17" map;
140 die-cut backprinted 1/2" counters;
8 pages of rules and scenarios;
Just Plain Wargames Folio Format
Cover Artwork by Adrian George
29284.name: CULLODEN: The Last of The '45

boardgamehonor.21296: 2007 Charles S. Roberts Best Wargame Graphics Nominee

29285.description:
(from MMP web site:)

From 1941 through 1943, Army Group South fought a campaign in southern Russia. Hitler issued goals that ranged from the far oil fields to a city on the Volga by the name of Stalingrad, finally deciding not to decide and ordered the far flung Army Group to divide and go for both.

Across endless steppe, in the blazing sun and freezing cold, the Axis legions advanced to the edge of Asia and the Caucasus mountains. Some of the oil fields, and most of the city were taken.

Then the Red Army had its turn...

Case Blue is a game that covers both the Axis advance (1941 and 1942) as well as the Soviet counterattacks (Nov 42 to Jan 43) and the German counteroffensive at Kharkov (Feb-March 1943) that ended the series of campaigns in the south. The game covers in great detail all the operations from October 1941 until May 1943 on a large play area extending from Voronezh almost to the Turkish border. The full scope and grandiose nature of these operations come to life here.

Case Blue covers and replaces the 1994 award winning game Enemy at the Gates. Players get to encircle Stalingrad, run their pocket and relief attempts and the many operations that game covered.

Case Blue is the 10th game in the award winning Operational Combat System and is the result of over 6 years of intensive research and testing. Players control units ranging from battalions through divisions (OK, there are a few very strange companies), making key decisions on the use, objectives, and means of war. The series is based on modern concepts of maneuver warfare and allows players a far more insightful look into how campaigns (large and small) really work.

Case Blue is designed to be played both separately or linked to the 2001 game Guderian's Blitzkrieg II. The monster linked game allows players to run operations on the entire Eastern Front (except for Leningrad) from the fall of 1941 until mid-1943.

Multiple scenarios (one map to very large) allow play to be picked up at various key points in the campaign.

If you want a serious look at these pivotal campaigns while having fun at the same time, this is the game for you.

Perhaps the Operational Combat System finest hour, this game is huge.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: Half Week
Hex: 5 miles / 8 Km
Units: Company to Division

Game Inventory:
Nine 22 x 34" full-color mapsheets (Maps A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, J, K)
One 14 x 22" full-color mapsheet (Map E)
Ten dual-side printed countersheets (2,660 1/2" Unit counters)
Three dual-side printed countersheets (840 1/2" Marker counters)
One 48-page OCS v4.0 series rules booklet
One 16-page Case Blue game rules booklet
One 80-page Case Blue Scenario Book 1
One 48-page Case Blue Scenario Book 2
One 24-page Case Blue Axis Booklet
One 24-page Case Blue Russian Booklet
Two 4-page two-color OCS v4.0 Charts & Tables booklets
Two 6-sided dice
29285.name: Case Blue

29286.description: Stratego with an American Civil War theme. The main difference from the standard version is that pieces have been renamed to fit the historic theme and given special abilities appropriate to the historic unit which the piece represents.
29286.name: Civil War Stratego

29287.name: Iran: 2007
29287.description: An Axis & Allies variant based on the "what-if" scenario of a US and NATO vs. Iran conflict set in 2007, using the card system of A&A: D-Day. Requires pieces from A&A: Europe to play. Includes WMDs and other new features.

29288.description:
Publisher's Description

This envelope contains 56 cards to help you bring new victims ... errr, gamers ... into the wonderful world of Munchkin ...

A special 17-card demonstration deck, drawn from the original Munchkin set, with the cards numbered so you can stack the deck and play out four scripted turns that show the basic Munchkin mechanics in just a couple of minutes. Instructions, dialog, and stupid jokes are included. Or use your own stupid jokes.

39 promo cards to give away to friends, customers, or total strangers. Four originally appeared in Munchkin Blender, but the versions here have standard Munchkin backs and new Kovalic art. The other one is brand new! Every munchkin will want them all. Will you be generous? Or will you demand tribute? Of course, you are a munchkin, so you will keep at least one of each for yourself, right?


9 copies of Stacked Deck, a brand new Door designed for munchkinly abuse.
9 copies of Ultra Munchkin, a Door that lets you have three classes.
9 copies of 1/3-Breed, a Door that lets you have three races.
6 copies of Portable Hole, a very useful Treasure.
6 copies of Cheat With Both Hands, a Treasure that lets you have two illegal items!



Other

Part of the Munchkin series

Limited edition: 5000 print run only.

The rules for the demo game, including printable versions of the demo game cards, are available as a free download from e23, the digital content distributor for Steve Jackson Games.

There is now an online Flash version of the demo.
29288.name: Munchkin Rigged Demo

29289.name: Back to the Future
29289.description:
"Back to the Future- the Board Game", is based on not one, but three films released in the 1980's. ("Back to the Future", "Back to the Future Part II", and "Back to the Future Part III".

You take the role of Marty, (played by Michael J. Fox in the films), and the objective of the game is to travel through 4 different time-zones and rescue Doc Emmett Brown from 1885, where he is trapped in time.

To travel through the game, and time, you will need a number of items, as used by Marty & Doc in the films:
- Delorean car, Time Flux Capacitator, to time travel
- Plutonium to power the Time Flux Capacitator
- 88 m.p.h. of speed to propel the car through time
- the famous Hoverboard used by Marty in Back to the Future II, & III
- the Clock Tower used by Doc in the original film to send Marty home

You will also encounter a number of problems on your time travels, including Biff - Marty's infamous adversary - and the time warp, which can send you back or forward in time.

Contents:
1 x playing board
1 x dice
4 x playing pieces & stands
40 x Black Speed Cards (32 x Gain Speed & 8 x Lose Speed)
32 x Blue Item Cards (8 x Plutonium, 8 x Biff, 8 x Delorean, 8 x Time Flux Capacitator)
16 x Yellow Hoverboard cards
12 x Yellow Clock cards
1 x Rules Leaflet

29290.name: Glücksferkel
29290.description:
Each player's piglet goes about collecting clovers. After each roll, the player must decide whether to keep seeking clovers, or run back to stow the clovers in her wheelbarrow, so the other players can't filch them. The player who secures the most points in clovers wins.

Ages 5 and up.

HABA 4176

29291.description: Tako Judo – the timeless sport of octopus wrestling – is an abstract strategy game for 2 to 4 players in which the object is to prevent your opponent(s) from being able to move. Played on a 64-square board (for two players) or a 100-square board (for three or four players), each player controls the head and eight tentacles of an octopus. The head takes up a 2x2 square area, and each tentacle takes up one square. Any piece can move like a Chess queen (any distance along an open orthogonal or diagonal line, but without jumping) provided that there is also a clear line of sight between that piece's original location and the head piece for the octopus to which it belongs. A player whose octopus is no longer able to effectively move its head or any tentacles (either move them at all or only harmlessly move a tentacle back and forth between a couple of squares) is pinned and eliminated from the game. Last octopus to move freely controls the sea and wins the game.
29291.name: Tako Judo

29292.name: They Think It's All Over
29292.description: The board game based on the classic T.V. game show. Players divide into two teams. Each team member gets their chance to play such well-known rounds as the "Name Game", "Expert Summary" and "Sporting Moments". The aim is to collect eight cards which spell out "IT IS NOW!".

29293.name: Glücksrad
29293.description:
Glücksrad is a simple card driven betting game for 2-6 players. Players receive a hand of 8 cards with different movement points (+, - and +/-)printed on them. By playing those cards, the players move the same figure around the "wheel of fortune".
Before playing those cards the players have to secretly predict where the figure will end after all cards are played, thus receiving more or less points at the end (which can eventually be doubled by a joker).

After 6 complete rounds, the winner is decided.
A special twist is the "canyon" at the bottom of the wheel which can only be crossed by playing a special card.

39357.name: World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game – Artumnis Moondream Character Pack

29294.description:
Text from the publisher's web site:
World of Warcraft: the Adventure Game is a competitive, quick-moving romp through the world of Warcraft. Taking your character from humble beginnings to the dizzying heights of power, challenging dangerous monsters and the dangers of your fellow players, will you be the one to emerge victorious?

World of Warcraft: the Adventure Game features high-quality plastic figures and competitive gameplay for 2-4 players.


Multiple playable characters with detailed plastic miniatures representing the races and classes from the World of Warcraft universe.
Competitive adventure, battling other players and the dangerous denizens of Azeroth.
Accessible, engaging gameplay.


World of Warcraft: the Adventure Game
WC06 $39.95

The base game includes a Male Dwarf Hunter (Burbonn Fang), Male Orc Warrior (Grumbaz Crowsblood), Female Undead Mage (Sofeea Icecall), and Female Human Warlock (Sandrai Darkshine).

Text from the Box:
Epic Legends Forged Daily
Long ago, the sorcerer Medivh opened a portal to another world. Through this dark gateway came the Horde - armies of orcs and ogres driven by a simple purpose: war. Since then, the land of Azeroth has not known peace. The Alliance of humans, dwarves, and elves fought two wars against the Horde, then both were nearly destroyed by the arival of the undead Scourge and the demonic Burning Legion. Now, the land is imperiled by undead, demons, beasts, and brigands.
For those bold enough to adventure, the dangers are great... but so are the opportunities!
World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game is a board game of questing and battle in the world of Azeroth. This fast-paced game pits 2-4 players in a struggle for glory and valor as they travel the Eastern Kingdoms battling monsters, completing quests, and vanquishing each other in their bid for supremacy.
Each player takes on the role of one of four distinct characters, each with his own unique deck of ability cards for battling countless enemies, including other players! A straightforward, but robust combat system keeps the action moving quickly as characters grow in power and accumulate treasure. A wide variety of discoveries, events, and location make every game unique and immersive.
Only one hero can be the greatest adventurer in Azeroth!

Expanded by:

World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game – Dongon Swiftblade Character Pack - Male Troll Rogue
World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game – Zowka Shattertusk Character Pack - Female Orc Shaman
World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game – Brandon Lightstone Character Pack - Male Human Paladin
World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game – Artumnis Moondream Character Pack - Male Night Elf Druid
World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game – Brebo Bigshot Character Pack - Male Gnome Mage
World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game – Shailara Witherblade Character Pack - Female Night Elf Warrior
World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game – Wennu Bloodsinger Character Pack - Female Troll Priest
World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game – Thundershot Character Pack - Male Tauren Hunter
29294.name: World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game

29295.name: Tour of New Zealand
29295.description:
Each player strives to be the first to complete a tour of New Zealand, visiting many towns and cities along the way.

Rules:
1. Each player takes a separate counter and by casting the dice in turn, determines how many spaces he or she will move.
2. The players will follow the instructions printed on the squares on which they land.
3. Should a player land on a square occupied by another player he or she will return to the nearest town.
4. Should a player throw a six, another turn will be taken.
5. A player must cast the exact score to finish the game.
6. The first player to complete the tour is the winner.

29296.description:
Originally published for the UK market, this expansion is separate from the North American All-Star Sports editions, the Sports mini pack, or any other sports-themed edition.

Categories include:

Soccer
Cricket and Rugby
Track Field and Swimming
Thrills and Spills
Ball Bashers
Extras




The expansion contains only one large (500 card) card box held inside the outer box. It requires a Trivial Pursuit Master Game to play.
29296.name: Trivial Pursuit: Sports Edition

29297.name: Vancouveropoly
29297.description:
Vancouveropoly is a wealth acquisition game. The object is to obtain the most money and businesses. Players start with $2500 cash which is used to buy the un-owned businesses that they land on. A player must pay rent to the owner if the business is already owned. The rent increases if the business has one or more retail outlets or an office tower.

It will be helpful to compare this game to it's cousin, Monopoly;
- there is no element of bidding for un-purchased properties, although players are encouraged to "make your own deals!"
- Money paid for Socks or Bonds cards is put in the centre as a jackpot for landing on the Free Parking square
- On rolling doubles, a player may move the the token the sum of both dice, or double that amount. The player does not get to roll again after rolling doubles.
- There is no payment for passing Go on each lap of the board, so financial resources are more limited.
- Players pay $100 to get out of Court (Jail).
- The game ends when one player becomes bankrupt.

The game is very commercial. The board and the Stocks and Bonds cards read like advertisements for local businesses. They often include real world addresses and phone numbers. There are two Coupon cards included with the Stocks and Bonds cards that appear to be intended for use as real-world coupons at those businesses.

boardgamehonor.8421: 2009 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee

29298.description:
In the dark and secret parts of the world, foul Overlords plot and scheme to unleash great evil and cover the world in suffering. Only those Heroes brave enough to journey into the dark and oppose them can save the known world from disaster.

The Road to Legend represents a new way to play Descent with the introduction of campaign rules and an overland map of Terrinoth.
29298.name: Descent: The Road to Legend

boardgameaccessory.72997: Descent: Road to Legend Lieutenants – Dar Hilzernod

29299.name: Doctor Who and the Dalek Spinomatic game
29299.description:
Join the Doctor, K-9, Martha and Captain Jack in this boardgame as they race through time and space trying to be the first team to get safely to the finish zone. But beware; a lone Dalek is trying to EXTERMINATE you. This is one of the first products to feature the new assistant, Martha Jones.

Contains: 1 instruction sheet, 1 spinomatic unit, 12 playing pieces, 1 molded Dalek, and 1 gameboard.

29300.description:
The Koltov Corridor: Disaster at Brody July 1944, simulates yet another disaster for the German Army in 1944. This time, in July, from the 13th to 23rd, the German front at the Koltov area shattered from the weight of the Russian 3rd and 4th Tank armies breaking through a narrow 3-4 km gap in the German lines. As the 8th and 1st Panzer Divisions counterattacked, Russian aircraft filled the skies and wreaked carnage upon the 8th Panzer. Further north, a large German pocket had been created, which attempted to breakout. As German forces were tossed into the relief effort, the front shattered like glass. The 16th Pz and 20th PG Divisions but could barely hold their positions as the two massive Russian tank armies streaked for the Vistula River!

This unique game has both players secretly issuing orders (five to select from) to each one of their formations. When revealed, a player's plan may be enhanced or wrecked depending on the orders issued to the opposing formation! It captures the reality of war quite well. Combat losses are in strength points. The German has a hard road to hold in this game as the Russian tank armies exploit the Koltov gap that is always created. The Russian also has some hefty victory conditions that require most objectives on the map to be in their control. The further west they move, the easier the situation is for the Germans.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 12 hours
Hex: 2 miles / 3.2 kilometers
Units: Battalion to Division

Game Inventory:
Two 11x17" full color maps
Three single-side printed un-mounted countersheets (576 1/2" counters)(mounted counters are optional)
One 21-page rulebook
Five Player Aid Charts

Player Provided: Two 6-sided die

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Low
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 2 to 3 hours
29300.name: The Koltov Corridor: Disaster at Brody July 1944

29301.name: Highway
29301.description: Learn about highway laws with this interactive board game that has an actual moving road!

29302.description:
Summer is here and so are the bugs inside my cabin room. But so is the Old Spider. We help him deploy his webs around the room to catch those pesky pests. Each player sets the web, rolls the dice and sees which bugs are caught. It's not as easy as it sounds, because the pests keep buzzing around and can wriggle free from a web. We and the Old Spider will have to help each other make some clever choices.

Contents:
1 game board
2 bug dice
6 bug tokens
2 spider webs
rules
29302.name: Old Spider & The Fly

29303.name: Aunty Ruth's Apples
29303.description:
Aunty Ruth sends us into her orchards to gather apples. Fill the boxes and bring them to her little store by the highway, where lots of people stop by.

There are four different apples to pick -- some for eating, for making cider & juice, for baking, and for sauces. Each player spins to see from which orchard to pick apples. But watch out for the wormy ones or those chewed up by deer. When everyone has had a turn at the spinner, we help to fill as many of the different boxes as we can with the apples we picked.

Contents:
35 cards
1 spinner
store charts
rules

29305.name: How to Host a Scavenger Hunt: Sports Safari
29305.description: Teams compete to collect items of varying point values (ticket stub from a sporting event, e.g) and to take photographs of the team in certain venues. Gather back at the host's house for dinner and a review of the photos.

29306.name: How to Host a Scavenger Hunt: Traveler Safari
29306.description: Teams compete to collect items of varying point values (room key from a hotel, e.g) and to take photographs of the team in certain venues. Gather back at the host's house for dinner and a review of the photos.

29307.description:
Beyond the Dark Portal lies a broken land of adventure, mystery, and unfathomable peril. The once beauteous world of Draenor has been destroyed by the plotting of the orc shaman Ner'zhul – only Outland, a scarred and broken continent adrift in the Twisting Nether, remains.

Return to your ancestral homeland as a proud warrior of the Horde, or search for the heroic survivors of the Second War as a noble soldier of the Alliance. Take your World of Warcraft: the Board Game experience to new heights of power and depths of peril with The Burning Crusade Expansion.

Play as a Draenei shaman or a Blood Elf paladin. Unlock new powers and talents as you rise to level six. Challenge new Overlords, battle new monsters, purchase a flying mount, and venture into dangerous dungeons in both Azeroth and Outland.

Dozens of detailed plastic figures, with new monsters and new heroes.
Based on the fastest-selling computer game expansion of all time.
New game board, new Heroes, new monsters, new quests, new items, new powers, new rules, dungeons, flying mounts, Outland, and more!

Expands:

World of Warcraft: The Boardgame
29307.name: World of Warcraft: The Boardgame – The Burning Crusade

29308.description:
Beowulf: The Movie Board Game is a reimplementation of Reiner Knizia's Kingdoms. It's also not to be confused with the same author's Beowulf: The Legend. It's an abstract strategy clothed in a theme based on the movie directed by Robert Zemeckis. The players' goal is to score the most victory points by clever tile and figurine placement on the board, composed of squares arranged in a grid. Its layout is changed, as the game is divided into three chapters that feature slightly different sets of tiles that can be drawn. Clever hand management (of tiles and figurines) is also important in the game, as some of them can be used only once throughout the entire game. Gameplay is as follows:

1. On his or her turn, a player may either place a tile (which can be a negative or a positive number, feature a special power or not) or a figurine on the board. If the player wishes to place a tile, he/she can add one to his/her hand of two and place one of the three tiles. Special powers of these tiles may be: displace a figurine, swap a tile from the board from the one from a player's hand, block other tiles, increase the power of figurines in the same row/column, cancel positive numbers on tiles, swap two tiles on the board.

2. By placing tiles and figurines, players will form rows and columns. After the board is full, the value of each figurine is calculated. Each figurine has a value of 1-4. This value is multiplied by the sum of values of all tiles from tiles that are in its row and column. Special powers of tiles may apply here (like the increasing of figurines' power or blocking). Players evaluate all their figurines on the board and gain points equal to their value.

This game differs considerably from its predecessor (not all of these may apply to the third English edition by Fantasy Flight Games released in 2012):

1. In Kingdoms, all three acts took place on the same board. Here, the board is two-sided, with three varying grids.
2. There are more positive tiles than negative ones in this game, therefore situations when players lose points for their figurines are much less frequent.
3. Here, a player manages a hand of three tiles. In Kingdoms, the players had no hand. Instead, he/she drew a single tile which had to be placed on the board.
4. There are more tiles with special powers. More tiles can be swapped, even figurines can change their position, which didn't happen in Kingdoms.
29308.name: Beowulf: The Movie Board Game

29309.description:
Platoon level World War 2 miniature wargames rules.

Troops, Weapons & Tactics (TW&T) is not just a rule set. With 108 pages, 40 of which are in full colour, the gamer gets the rules, stats for Britain, Germany, the USSR and the USA for the 1944 and '45 period, a scenario and force generation system along with an introduction to the forces as they were historically organised and the tactics that they used.

TW&T, like its stablemate I Ain't Been Shot Mum (IABSM), uses a card driven system that produces a variable turn sequence. Unlike IABSM each squad leader is represented along with the platoon officer and Sergeant. These leaders use a system of Tactical Initiatives to motivate and activate their men on the battlefield.

Expanded by:

Rock the Casbah
29309.name: Troops, Weapons & Tactics

29310.name: Chinggis Khan: almidras Allah (the flail of God)
29310.description:
Chinggis Khan: almidras Allah is a solitaire game that covers the Mongol campaigns against the Khwarizmians in 1220 and 1221. This game was published in the first issue of battle-market magazine dated Spring 2007.

It contains 1 A4-sized map, 30 1/2" counters, and four pages of rules. An accompanying article is included in the same magazine.

Each turn represents 1 month and each counter represents 10,000 cavalry, 3000 engineers, or one leader. Sieges are a main focus of the game.

Two scenarios are included, historical and alternate. The alternative scenario challenges you to improve on Chinggis Khan's historical performance.

29311.description:
Across the Mediterranean lie the deserts and mountains of North Africa where soldiers of the British and German armies fight the greatest war in human history. Field Marshal Erwin Rommel leads a brilliant offensive against Commonwealth forces, far exceeding his orders and earning himself the nickname "The Desert Fox".

Tide of Iron: Days of the Fox, the first expansion for Tide of Iron, features the introduction of the British army and the North African campaigns, including new terrain tiles, new rules, new units, new scenarios, and nine new geomorphic double-sided map boards.
29311.name: Tide of Iron:  Days of the Fox

29312.name: Zeppelin: Peter Strasser's Blitz
29312.description:
Zeppelin covers the battle between Peter Strasser's German Naval Airship Division and British aerial defenses during World War I. This game was published in the first issue of battle-market magazine dated Spring 2007.

It contains 1 A4-sized maps, 2 A4-sized tracking aids, 50 1/2" counters, and four pages of rules. An accompanying article is included in the same magazine. All A4-sized components are back printed on the maps for other games in the same magazine.

The German side includes three types of zeppelins. Accidents may occur. The German player secretly plans his raids and the British player assigns defenses. The planned raids are revealed and any not negated by weather are resolved.

Each turn represents one month, and the game does have a variable endpoint.

Length of gameplay is an estimate.

29313.name: Hanba'al: Ambush at the Trebbia
29313.description:
This rendition of Hannibal's ambush of the combined Roman Consular armies at the confluence of the Trebbia and Po rivers was published in the first issue of battle-market magazine dated Spring 2007.

It contains 2 A4-sized maps, 60 1/2" counters, and six pages of rules. An accompanying article is included in the same magazine.

Length of gameplay is an estimate.

29314.name: Göteborgsvarvet
29314.description: Göteborgsvarvet is a localized and simplified variant of Monopoly. The players move around Gothenburg (the second largest city in Sweden), and buy investments in the city's tourist attractions and famous sites.

29315.name: Zed's Party
29315.description: ZED'S PARTY is an amazingly inventive and unusual game. HAVE YOU BEEN INVITED? Mime, Song, Dance and Drama make this an interactive and highly fun game. For any number of people from 4 up to 24, the game includes balloons, question cards and a full colour playing board. The inventor/designer of this game is Zed Rodgers, the actor/writer from London, UK. The game only had one production run despite it being described by some as the best and most versatile board game in the world. One of the directors of Zed'n'Co Games Ltd, went bankrupt from his other business and could not put money in for the second run, so a second director pulled out leaving Zed with no finances for a second run.

29316.description:
This is the original game by Elizabeth Magie, which was later sold and re-implemented as Monopoly.

Patented:

patent 748,626, Elizabeth Magie's The Landlord's Game
patent 1,509,312, Elizabeth Magie Phillips's The Landlord's Game, mark II








To do: Further information about this game, history and delineation from Monopoly.



-




Re-implemented as:

Finance and Fortune
Monopoly
Go to Texas
29316.name: The Landlord's Game

29317.description:
War, the Brazilian Risk-like game is making 35 years and to celebrate that they're releasing this new light wargame: War - Império Romano takes the same mechanics to a new level. This game focus on shorter game length than its predecessor and allows for less players (3 or 4 in this version, compared to 3 to 6 in the original version).

From the official rules manual (in portuguese):
The Roman empire was one of the greatest and longest empires in history. It started before the birth of Christ (B.C.) and lasted, in the East, until year 476 A.D. (anno domini) and, in the West, until 1453 A.D. Let us go back to year 140 D.C., when this Empire reached its greatest extension and dominated practically all Europe, part of Asia and northern Africa. Times that were not completely peaceful, for enemies threatened the borders of the empire and the conquered people insurrected against domination, seeking freedom. Go back in time with War: Roman Empire and feel the thrill of defending your borders and advancing your legions, conquering provinces of the roman world in 140 A.D.! Observe, though, that the political division of the provinces adopted in the board objectives to ease the game mechanics, and not portrait the reality of that age. All province and sea names are written in latin. Only the region names are in portuguese. Each players is dealt an objective, that will only be known by himself. The knowledge of this objective by other players will make your conquest harder. It is important for the player to, when reading the rules, try some practical plays, simulating, inclusively, the mentioned examples. This way it will be much easier to understand the mechanisms of WAR.

Re-implements:

War
29317.name: War: Império Romano

29318.name: Sexual Q&A
29318.description:
Published by Avalon Hill's Victory Games. Here's the information from the box:

Front: Sexual Q&A - An Outrageous Card game of Sexual Questions and Answers. Authenticated by Dr. Ruth Westheimer.

Back: This is a provocative sex-oriented card game for 2 or more players of consenting age. The object is to correctly answer situations provided in a true or false format. The situations are taken from those posted by Dr. Ruth Westheimer's long-running "Ask Dr. Ruth" radio and TV program.

See image for example cards on the back of the box.

29319.name: Spacey Gamey
29319.description:
From the box:

Spacey Game is a revolutionary new game that puts simplicity back into miniatures gaming. The fast paced action game lets you create your own ship and then battle with other ships designed by friends. To the Victor Go the Spoils and if your ship wins it will grow stronger to play again.

29320.name: Pokémon Battling Coin Game
29320.description:
Battle your Pokemon monsters with coin-to-coin action in this fast and collectible battle game.

Each player selects three coins to battle with. One at a time they are flipped over and spun. Both players stop their coins and push them together, then compare what wedges on the coins come in contact. If your wedge is greater, your opponent's Pokemon is knocked out! The player who knocks out all of their opponent's Pokemon wins the game!

Gotta catch 'em all!

29321.name: The Ultimate Dice Game Compendium
29321.description:
"All the classic favourites including Poker Dice, Macro, Drop Dead, Chicago, Tit for Tat, Double Trouble, Ninety Nine."

A collection of dice games compiled by Reiner Knizia. Although advertised as containing "over 40 games", it actually contains 35 games plus 8 variants. The set contains a rulebook plus dice and accessories.

Original designs by Reiner Knizia included are: Double Trouble, Hunter, Katego, Matches, Tit for tat and Triple Poker.

29322.name: Hatchlings
29322.description:
Hatchlings
A fantasy themed game in which each player controls 5 characters and attempts to move them across a field of nasty, giant, grub like hatchlings. The hatchlings appear in random locations on each and every turn. Creature tiles appear on the field through the use of randomly drawn coordinate cards.
The 5 characters you control have different movement abilities and different defense abilities.
Each character has a value and the winner is the player who successfully maneuvers the highest number of his characters across the field without them being eaten.

29323.name: Picture Millionaire

boardgamefamily.6027: TV Series: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire

29323.description:
Picture Millionaire is the exciting update to Who Wants To Be A Millionaire and now gives you the chance to test your wits against your friends and family. Containing new picture & question cards in the familiar Millionaire format, now played on a board, includes all the usual lifelines plus answer tokens and a new 'take the money' option.

A game based on the Number One Quiz Show but now with a unique and exciting twist! Adding a new dimension to the tension and thrill of the original game, Picture Millionaire uses a wide range of images to challenge your general knowledge skills.

A game for up to 8 players, where each person takes it in turn to act as the host.

29324.name: Cold Feet
29324.description:
Cold Feet is chock-full of great and hilarious moments as Adam, Rachel, Pete, Jenny, Karen and David all battle to make the best of their careers, families and friendships. Now you can join in their struggle for happiness by playing the game.

Based on the hit UK TV drama.

29325.name: All About Pueblo
29325.description: All About Pueblo is a monopoly type game where players roll and move around town fulfilling lists of items available at the buildings where the sponsors of the game are located. It is a typical advertising/marketing game for the city in 1981, and contains item lists, money, standees, and a nice 6 piece interlocking board.

29326.name: Operation Survival
29326.description:
Operation Survival is a strategy game for budding adventurers as well as experienced explorers. And no matter what happens, you'll be sitting on the edge of your seat, laughing your head off!

Game Objective:

Your plane crashed in a remote land, and now you have to survive in this hostile territory. You and the other survivors from the wreck face extremely harsh conditions, but only one of you will come out of this alive... It's the survival of the fittest! Your best allies - courage, toughness and the ability to hit the ground running - will get you through the trials and tribulations Nature has in store...and help you outsmart your unlucky companions!

Contents:
- 25 cardboard tiles which make up the game board
- 120 "Survival" question cards (a total of 360 detailed questions)
- 27 "Challenge" cards
- 3 "Object" cards
- 5 "Adventurer" pawns
- 1 "Creature" reference sheet
- Game rules.

29327.description:
This is the 3rd Expansion Supplement for Battlestations

Tagline:
Explore, plunder or pirate on your own or privateer for the U.R.E.F.

"Unfurl the Solar Sails! Bring the ship about and fire the Fusion Cannon! Show you colors and capture the most black-hearted pirates in the Orion Spur as a Universal Republic privateer... or pirate the trade routes dry and drown in the bounty.

The Shifty Trundilians are the new cover in the Galaxy, and there is no shortage of smugglers, cutthroats and villainy. A rogue's gallery of villains and vessels stand between you and your treasure.

Are you a hero? Or are you a pirate?"

New Species: Trundilians
New Modules: Fusion Cannon, Gravity Lance

This book brings space faring swashbuckling into the Battlestations universe and is anticipated to be the best received expansion yet.
29327.name: Battlestations: Pirates of Trundlia

29328.name: Gunslingers & Desperados
29328.description: Gunslingers & Desperados is a miniatures combat game set in the American Old West, circa 1850-1900. Designed for 25mm miniatures, with a max # of about 15 per side. Rules for hidden movement, spotting attempts, ammunition and one-on-one old-west style gun duels are all included. Also included is a character generator for creating memorable combatants with a wide range of abilities and weapons. G&D is designed to be used with any 25mm scale figures.

29329.name: Conflict 2000
29329.description:
Conflict 2000 :Modern Combat Rules takes the rules used in Stellar Conflicts & Uprisings, and uses them to depict combat between modern forces, from the 1970's up to 2000 (and beyond). Using hidden counters, tactical movement and simultaneous combat, Conflict 2000 keeps all players actively involved during the game. Conflict 2000 incorporates rules for vehicles, artillery, engineer support, leadership and experience, all of which can be of vital importance in determining the outcome.

Designed to use miniatures from any manufacturer, Conflict 2000 players can choose between the 25mm scale, for more detailed, personal combat, or 15mm for platoon-level action with more vehicles.


(from the Tactical Command website): "The main strategy of the rules system CONFLICT 2000 is to give a feel for the modern forces and their basic combat configuration as for troop’s equipment and armor vehicles. We at Tactical Command Games firmly believe that the acronym (METT-T) Missions, Equipment, Troops, Terrain and Time, will dictate situations on the modern battlefields. So with that in mind go ahead and have fun playing the game."

29330.name: Stellar Fire
29330.description:
Stellar Fire is a space-combat miniatures game, handling battles of any size from single ship-to-ship, all the way up to massive fleets. Using a hidden counter tactical movement system and simultaneous combat, Stellar Fire keeps all players active and involved, minimizing downtime. Stellar Fire is designed to work with any miniatures on the market!

With five unique alien races and three separate human factions, Stellar Fire's scenario generator ensures that your games will never get stale.

Web site
http://site.tacticalcommandgames.com/

29331.name: Call It: the Family Home Football Game
29331.description:
Comes in a tube. From the 'front' of the tube:

"Play along with your favorite NFL, WFL, or college game. Ages 8 to Adult."

And from the 'back':

"Match your football strategy and wits in an exciting new sports game that challenges players to compete against one another LIVE - on your television set!

"CALL IT is played simultaneously with your favorite college, NFL, or WFL football game. Any Football Game, from Monday Night Football to the Orange Bowl, the Superbowl, Rose Bowl, or even a video tape of previously played games can be used to play CALL IT. It's nonstop, fun-filled family excitement right in the comfort of your living room.

"It's 2nd down and 5 yards on your own 35. Do you think your team will run it or pass it! You decide! Over 400 combinations available. Will they be sacked?... Fumble... Incomplete Pass?

"Choose wisely and win big. Choose poorly and you'll sit it out on the bench. You'll never know who's right until it happens on your television.

"Win or lose, you make the call. CALL IT! The final word in interactive football games."

GAME CONTAINS
13" x 17" Game Board
Play Money
Tokens & Rules

For more information or to order call 916 387-1925

29332.name: Fame Academy
29332.description:
From the back of the box:

Can you handle instant STARDOM?
Enter the Fame Academy and show that you have the flair and determination to succeed and everyone else is eliminated.

Will you be the first student to take centre stage and embrace fame?

Based on the BBC UK TV show of the same name.

29333.name: Mission Space
29333.description:
The games in the Adventure series involve you in the search for the mythical Jonah Expedition which vanished 20 years ago. The few bits and pieces of information remaining indicate that Doctor Jonah was on the verge of discovering the vestiges of an ancient civilization...


A unique scenario and fun-filled technique
Captivating role-playing
Game boards that can be assembled for playing on 1-3 universes
Collectible games with extended Internet play option


Game Objective

The adventure continues... deep in space! Your investigation of the disappearance of Dr Jonah and his expedition brings you to other planets. Aboard a space ship, at the wheel of a moon buggy or in a space base control room, your journey is sure to be full of ups and downs! You have to go head-on with unidentified objects and avoid the numerous traps waiting for you along the way, because only the most courageous will be able to uncover the true secret of the Jonah expedition!

Contents:

- 1 hexagonal, illustrated game board
- 42 "Expedition" cards
- 39 "Space" cards
- 1 "Off-Limits" card
- 6 "Super Expedition" cards
- 2 "Pulsar" cards
- 2 special dice
- 7 Pennants
- 1 "Top Secret" Envelope
- game rules

29334.name: Hello!
29334.description:
Based on the UK gossip mag "Hello!"

The greater your celebrity IQ the better chance you have of winning - the multiple choice answers give everyone an opportunity to score. Each player gets the chance to answer every question so there's no waiting around for your turn. Guess when events happened to get bonus points to fast track your victory. Easy scoring system means there's no need to keep note of the scores. Over 1500 questions for hours of game play with new questions every time.

Based totally on celebrity news from HELLO! magazine.

29335.name: Nature Sauvage
29335.description:
What would you say to a nice trek through the National Parks of France? Based on a subtle blend of visual and question/answer games, Nature Sauvage reveals to you the marvelous secrets of the fauna, flora, and countryside of France. An ideal game to avoid staying at home!


An exploration of French nature like you've never seen before
More than 300 superb photos
An exciting game with two levels of difficulty


Aim of the Game

You set off to discover some of the most unbelievable animals, the most fascinating plants, and the most sumptuous countrysides that make up our natural spaces. The objective: to be the first trekker to rejoin the ranger station by performing mimes, solving puzzles, identifying silhouettes, and answering multiple choice questions. Through its action, thought-provoking nature, and above all its humor, Nature Sauvage will satisfy both young and old, novice and enthusiast.

Contents:
- 1 game board
- 270 Fauna, Flora, Park, and Countryside cards
- 10 Trek cards
- 45 Mime-Puzzle cards
- 30 Tokens
- 6 Mushroom pawns
- 1 wooden die
- 1 rule book

This game is only available in French.

29336.name: Name Dropping
29336.description:
From the back of the box:

Madonna, Coconuts, Mud Wrestling and a Naked Mole Rat... What do they all have in common? Absolutely nothing... except that they could all turn up during an outrageous game of Name Dropping!

Against the clock, you have to describe wildly diverse characters and objects to your team-mates... But beware of your opponents! They'll do ANYTHING to put you off and it's all within the rules!!

Fun, freaked, frustrating - it's a game to drive you bonkers!

29337.name: Zixiz
29337.description:
From the back of the box:

Six stacks of tokens, six to a stack. Six Dice. Zixiz

Roll the dice to capture opponents' tokens. But be careful, the tokens aren't the only things at risk in Zixiz. If your attack goes badly, precious dice could fall into enemy hands.

Every turn, a new decision. Will you dare a bold attack, or lie back, hoping to outlast? Will you attempt to end the Zixiz round while you hold a small advantage, or will you take chances to grab lasting power?

Dominance comes quickly in Zixiz, and just as quickly slips away. The game is truly never over until the last die is cast.

Zixiz is one great game. But that doesn't mean it has to be the same great game every time. Included are suggestions for "house rules." Tweak play to make the game faster, riskier, longer, more strategic, higher scoring...the possibilities are nearly endless.

Add more sets to add more players.

29338.name: Trivial Pursuit The Music Master Game: Family Pop & Rock Edition
29338.description: Trivial Pursuit expansion, similar to 60's music edition. Includes music CD.

29340.name: Super Mario Bros. Crystal Maze
29340.description: Race a metal marble that represents Mario through a maze. You control him via a joystick in this non-electronic labyrinth maze game. You must collect 4 flags before attempting to attack Bowser in the center of the maze.

29341.name: Adugo
29341.description:
Game created by the Brazilian Indians from Bororo tribe, on Pantanal region. Originally the board was designed on the dust, and pieces were little stones.

One "Jaguar" (Panthera onca) must capture 5 of the 14 dogs. The dogs must trap the "jaguar". The "jaguar" moves like the checkers pieces and "jump" the dogs to capture them. The dogs move like the king from chess.

29342.name: Inquisition
29342.description:
Accuse, interrogate, and detain all those suspicious- for you are an Inquisitor, and it is your quest to be the most righteous defender of the faith! Expose as much wickedness as you can, but never lose sight of your rivals- for they too seek to be the most righteous. Torturous fun for the whole family!

Everyone hides either a Witch, Blasphemer, or Heretic. On your turn, either take a prediction card that says how many of a particular type there are hidden, or accuse someone of hiding a Witch, Blasphemer, or Heretic. If you are right, you score whatever they were hiding. If you're wrong, you lose your prediction, and everyone else scores. Inquisition has been compared to "Liar's Dice" but in a simpler card game form.

Available from Robot Martini at http://www.robotmartini.com/games

29343.name: Stellar Conflicts & Uprisings
29343.description:
The ground combat companion to Tactical Command Games' spaceship combat Rules Stellar Fire, Stellar Conflicts & Uprisings takes the same game concepts and applies them to squad and platoon level infantry combat (but can be played up to company level). Includes rules for vehicles, engineer support, and artillery.

SC&U uses hidden counter movement, spotting attempts and simultaneous combat rules designed to keep all players involved and active during play.

Like Stellar Fire, SC&U's rich universe with 5 alien races and three human factions are used by an included scenario generator to create a endless amount of interesting game setups.

29344.name: Pedal Power
29344.description:
Pedal Power is a unique game based on bicycle touring. The goal of Pedal Power is to be the bicyclist who has the most fun. The player with the most Joy Points at the end of the game had the most fun and is the winner of the game!

Players plan their trips and attend bicycle events (Weekend and Week Long Tours as well as Expeditions) for experiences and fun. Experiences earn the players Joy Points. The players will enjoy Bed & Breakfast, Camping, Mountain Biking, Tandem and Winery experiences throughout the game. Experiences can be had many times as joy and fun are not confined to one trip.

The players will also experience days where skies are blue, roads are smooth and enjoy tail winds. Other days players will be chased by dogs, have headwinds, rough roads, flat tires and thunderstorms. During the game players will be able to take all these Joy and Misery experiences and 'Tell A Story' and earn Joy points.

29345.name: David Dickinson's Antique Chase
29345.description:
Based on the UK TV show "Bargain Hunt".

David Dickinson's Antique Chase is a traditional board game, where you will need skill and strategy to collect the right antique items and win the game. You spend funny money from 'The Bank of Dickinson' complete with David's picture on the notes. Take the chance to be the auctioneer and get your opponents to outbid one another.

'Bargain Hunt' has become an extremely popular television show, and we all love watching both the huge profits and losses made by the contestants. Well, now you can show off your antique-spotting skills, with "The Duke's" very own board game!

As orange as ever, David Dickinson leads players on an antique chase to complete their collection. Real bargains and pieces of tat are all intermingled together, meaning the purchases you make have to be wise if they’re to make a profit. If it’s as cheap as chips, be wary, but you also need ensure you’re not stung with those pricey purchases.

Based on the same style playing board used in Monopoly, each square gives you something to do, whether its send an item to auction or swap them with your opponents.

29346.name: Ragadorn Alehouse Brawl
29346.description:
Ale-House Brawl was included in the Magnamund Companion, an encyclopedia about the world of Lone Wolf by Joe Dever. It is a turn-based boardgame that also can be played as a simple role playing game. The game takes place in a tavern where ten characters attempt to complete given objectives, usually to kill some other character. The game looks rather simple, it includes rules for combat and movement, but can often produce absurd and very entertaining situations.

The game was re-published in Roleplayer Independent (Volume 1, Issue 12 - Nov 1993).

The game can now be downloaded for free from Project Aon.

29347.name: Spot The Intro CD Edition
29347.description:
Different to the board game and DVD versions.
Spot The Intro, the famous game in which you have to recognize songs from short musical clips. Each pack includes pencils, score pads and an audio CD. Newly repackaged, they make excellent gifts and will provide hours of top entertainment!

29349.name: Eloise Rawther Exciting Card Game
29349.description: This game combines three different games; all are set collection games. One is a version of Snap, the second is a passing game, and the third is version of Go Fish where you have to act out the picture on the card to get a match.

29350.description:
This is three games in one. You have the Match 'em! Card Game, the Sneak-a-Peek Card Game and the Memory Matching Game. Each game is played differently.

In Match 'em! Card Game, you are trying to place four cards in a row, in Sneak-a-Peek Card Game, you are trying to collect three matching cards, and in Memory Matching Game, you are trying to collect the most cards by making matches.
29350.name: Blue's Clues Card Game

29351.description:
Durak is the most well known and popular card game in Russia and Ukraine. Durak, meaning fool, is the title given to the loser of the game - the last player to get rid of their cards. It is a game of skill and can be played by two to six players playing individually or with four people, playing in two teams of two.

Durak uses the Russian deck of 36 cards or can be played with a standard deck of cards with the 2-5 inclusive removed.
29351.name: Durak

29352.description:
A brief description from BGN's own Andrea "Liga" Ligabue (Boardgame News):

This game is the sequel to Lupus in Tabula; the Tabula inhabitants have moved into the city, but there is a little problem—the werewolves have moved there, too! This game keeps the theme and part of the mechanism of the famous party-game precursor, but this time it's for 3-8 players. Note that Lupusburg isn't an expansion, although it is possible to combine parts of the two games.
29352.name: Lupusburg

29353.name: Lim
29353.description:
To understand the game Lim you first have to understand Leeyon's Cube Cards.
